Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/25030/2/check/gate-swift-pep8/1945 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25030/2/check/gate-swift-docs/1776 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25030/2/check/gate-swift-python26/2024 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25030/2/check/gate-swift-python26-rhel6/4 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/25030/2/check/gate-swift-python27/2026 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25030/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/9906 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25030/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/15352 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25030/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/9621 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-03-21 18:20:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I love it!  But no callers yet?

I'm guessing some of the recon-collecting code could spit out some gauge metrics when it's writing out recon cache data?

Were there other places you're considering adding gauge metrics?

Guess it's time to update our statsd to take gauges, hehe... (been on my list, but never near the top).

(will have to do real review later)"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-03-21 18:38:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Unfortunately, the StatsD packet format for gauges is sort of crappy, so this won't work for negative numbers.

See https://github.com/etsy/statsd/blob/master/docs/metric_types.md#gauges and look at the bit about negative numbers.

The fix is easy; if value is negative, send a 0, then the value.

Also, are you planning to add a caller for this? (I'm just curious; an answer like "yes, but in private middleware" would be entirely reasonable.)'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-03-21 18:41:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

And to avoid a race condition, you have to send the zero and then the value in a single packet. 

Blah.'}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2013-03-21 18:52:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

To be honest I hadn't even noticed that etsy's statsd ended up supporting delta's (just saw the original patch come across and updated our version of statsd). I'll mark this as a work in progress and fix it up.

I haven't added any callers yet, was just adding it to use in an external (for now) project (https://github.com/pandemicsyn/swift-ring-master/blob/master/srm/ringmasterd.py) but figured it be handy to have in down the road."}, {'account_id': 1603, 'date': '2013-03-21 18:52:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-29 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-29 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Add statsd gauge

- Add gauge support to statsd logger: `logger.gauge(metricname,
  value, samplerate)`

Change-Id: Ifc4582f9a735d7c22ea3cb9f36349296682d3b5c

commit_message:
remove use-config-templates from cinder-config:

use-config-templates has been deprecated, and must
not be used by the cinder element.

This change relies on os-refresh-config instead.

Change-Id: Ie8594fa99d05032fa0e7a425a9dd278910b80cab

commit_message:
Add flag for skipping the actual devstack run.

There are jobs in development, such as the testing of nova-baremetal
and/or diskimage-builder which want to make use of the devstack-gate
infrastructure for all of the caching and pre-work that we do, but
don't actually directly want to run devstack itself.

Change-Id: I8dc735bc281c7a7eeee4485e2c47ab1fa417a49e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-28 01:53:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes improper msg when run cinder list w/o env variable

When run 'cinder list' without load the source keystonerc, got the improper
error message from the stdout like below:
===
[root@localhost ˜]# cinder list
/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/cinderclient/shell.py:493: DeprecationWarning:
BaseException.message has been deprecated as of Python 2.6
  print >> sys.stderr, "ERROR: %s" % e.message
ERROR: You must provide a username via either --os-username or env[OS_USERNAME]
===

But it would be nice if message is as below so as to be consistent with the
others:
===
[root@localhost ~]# cinder list
ERROR: You must provide a username via either --os-username or env[OS_USERNAME]
[root@localhost ~]#
===

Fixes bug: 1156960

Change-Id: Iaf6b76c51ce30803ea77df8e71004acbff016d18
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes improper msg when run cinder list w/o env variable

When run 'cinder list' without load the source keystonerc, got the improper
error message from the stdout like below:
===
[root@localhost ˜]# cinder list
/usr/lib/python2.6/site-packages/cinderclient/shell.py:493: DeprecationWarning:
BaseException.message has been deprecated as of Python 2.6
  print >> sys.stderr, "ERROR: %s" % e.message
ERROR: You must provide a username via either --os-username or env[OS_USERNAME]
===

But it would be nice if message is as below so as to be consistent with the
others:
===
[root@localhost ~]# cinder list
ERROR: You must provide a username via either --os-username or env[OS_USERNAME]
[root@localhost ~]#
===

Fixes bug: 1156960

Change-Id: Iaf6b76c51ce30803ea77df8e71004acbff016d18

commit_message:
Enforce exclusive options snapshot-id, source-volid and image-id

Fixed checks in api that volume create receives only one of
snapshot-id, source-volid or image-id.

Fixes bug #1161437

Change-Id: Ibe5ca4bb81e69b0f8e1abe1c2cffe587dc10e3ca

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-29 03:39:46.000000000', 'message': "Add support for Hash Prefix

A new configuration parameter is added to /etc/swift/swift.conf
[swift-hash]
swift_hash_path_prefix = 'random unique string'

New installations are advised to set this parameter to a random secret,
which would not be disclosed ouside the organization.
The same secret needs to be used by all swift servers of the same cluster.

Existing installations should set this parameter to an empty string
(the default)

DocImpact

Fixes: Bug #1157454

Change-Id: I63b10d0b7d6dd3f74e0f10bb41b5f240fa03578a
(cherry picked from commit a979c8007bf7376541c932c3e91d5ba1a95f4481)
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for Hash Prefix

A new configuration parameter is added to /etc/swift/swift.conf
[swift-hash]
swift_hash_path_prefix = 'random unique string'

New installations are advised to set this parameter to a random secret,
which would not be disclosed ouside the organization.
The same secret needs to be used by all swift servers of the same cluster.

Existing installations should set this parameter to an empty string
(the default)

DocImpact

Fixes: Bug #1157454

Change-Id: I63b10d0b7d6dd3f74e0f10bb41b5f240fa03578a
(cherry picked from commit a979c8007bf7376541c932c3e91d5ba1a95f4481)

(cherry picked from commit 05c8d61aebb39d8695c5b295ff399e87e4749540)

[{'created': '2013-03-22 18:33:07.000000000', 'message': 'Add Fibre Channel doc updates

With the added fibre channel support for volume attachment, the

commit_message:
Add Fibre Channel doc updates

With the added fibre channel support for volume attachment, the
compute node now needs a few additional packages to be installed.
This addition covers those packages that are now required.

Change-Id: Ie1c62e79d28c2827859eb4da450c21fc77a83ddb

I'm good with this, though it would be nice if we could tackle this with addCleanup"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-03-27 12:44:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

addCleanup probably not usable in this case :('}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-03-27 12:59:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-03-27 13:06:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I presume the issue is that if setUpClass does not return normally then tearDownClass will not get called. But in this change the isolated creds will still not get cleaned up, right? Also, the create_server method seems to add the server to the list that will be seen by clear servers right before it returns, so I don't understand how this new code changes anything. Finally, I think lots of resources are created in other setUpClass methods that do not do a thorough cleanup. Am I missing something big here?"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-03-27 13:11:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

If the exception handler throws an exception before the 'raise' we will lose the original exception, we need to log it ASAP."}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-03-27 13:50:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@David Kranz
Yes, you are right. The issue is that if setUpClass does not return normally then tearDownClass will not get called. And addCleanup will be called after tearDown, so I think it cann't work in this case. In this patch I didn't think about isolated creds, I will update to clean it. I have changed the code of create_server in another patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25267/ (just don't want to rebase it :), sorry for inconvenience in your review), so it can work."}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-03-27 13:52:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

will clean up isolated creds"}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2013-03-27 13:59:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

OK, thanks for the clarification. If we really want to make sure that partially completed setUpClass calls don't leave stuff behind, we have to act as if the the failure to call tearDownClass is a bug. We should make sure that each setUpClass leaves a trail of things to be deleted and that tearDownClass won't fail regardless of what happened during setUpClass. Then if setUpClass fails we just call tearDownClass manually. The problem with the current patch is that if anything ever gets added to BaseCompute tearDownClass then the subclasses will all have to be changed. This does imply that many setUpClass will need a try/except which is unfortunate. Perhaps this could be done at a higher level but that gets into the test driver infrastructure."}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-03-27 14:13:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@David Kranz
I agree with you. Maybe we can have a better management about these resource.

@afazekas
I agree with you. But in this case, clear_servers won't throw a exception."}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-03-28 05:19:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: No score

@David Kranz
I think _get_isolated_creds shouldn't throw an exception. I will submit another patch to fix it. This patch just fix bug 1158838."}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-03-28 05:33:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-03-28 05:33:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 5586, 'date': '2013-03-28 05:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

sorry, should bug 1158843'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2013-03-28 06:13:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I agree with David in that we should call tearDownClass manually. I'd guess we have quite a few of these sorts of issues with setupClass.

This is one of the reasons for moving to testresources long term. testtools doesn't support setUpClass (we're sort of getting it accidentally through the test discovery). But if/when we move to the OptimisingTestSuite with testresources we no longer get the setupClass hooks."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-28 06:18:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
delete servers in setUpClass if ecxeption raised

this catch the exception in setUpClass of test_images_oneserver
and delete the server. Every exception should be catched
so hasn't specify what kind of exception after except.

fix bug 1158843

Change-Id: I4ea4f6b4bc97a514393c0d0cb6236dcc720fd1a0

'}, {'account_id': 694, 'date': '2013-03-29 02:46:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: (1 inline comment)

Looks great! Two nitpicks:

reddwarf/common/exception.py defines three new exception types that are never caught in tests. It may be hard or unnatural to set up the fakes to raise these exceptions; if so, unit test cases might be easier.

Second, the tests expect int or string types for some fields, probably due to the XML serializer returning strings. There are two fixes for this.

1. Update python-reddwarfclient reddwarfclient/xml.py's TYPE_MAP by adding the new root table name for the security groups, and under the fields that are int making a key with the same name whose value is int.
2. Check if the client is the XML serializer and if so check for basestring instead:

def expected_int_type(client):
    # Check if we're using the XML client 
    # (see this for an example: https://github.com/stackforge/reddwarf/blob/master/reddwarf/tests/api/header.py)    
    if ... is xml client .. :
        return basestring
    else:
        return int

The important thing is to make sure the JSON version is checked to make sure we're getting ints (if we can hook up some JSON schema verification tool the same way as my experiments with xmllint maybe in the future this will be simpler)."}, {'account_id': 5293, 'date': '2013-03-29 02:46:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 5293, 'date': '2013-03-29 02:46:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-29 02:46:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Doesn't seem to work

2. Updated TYPE_MAP on the client side to specify type info for security group rules. (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25370/)

Please Note: Jenkins tests will fail until https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25370/ is merged.'}, {'account_id': 5293, 'date': '2013-03-29 02:46:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-29 02:46:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Added support for Security Groups via a new extension.

- Added migrate changes for new database artifacts.
- Added models for Security Groups and Security Group Rules.
- Definition and addition of Controllers for API.
- Views for Security Groups and Security Group rules.
- Extended taskmanager to use newly created  Security Group on instance
  creation, and to clean it up on deletion if extension is enabled
- Added new flag to conf to enable "reddwarf_security_groups_support"
- Integration tests.

Implements blueprint: security-groups

Change-Id: I44053359c12e53a9e549bd334e628ecd249d8ba0

commit_message:
Support for SSL in wsgi.Server

SSL are entirely optional. Support for SSL as well using code from glance. We
have some new options for configuring the SSL support. There are tests for
accessing a sample app w/o ipv6 or ssl, one with just ssl and one with
ipv6 and ssl

Fixes LP# 1101342

DocImpact

Change-Id: I824acef4130d27828dcf199736b3ca668d6202d7

[{'created': '2013-03-28 19:24:40.000000000', 'message': "Don't clobber all iSCSI connections during nova cleanup

The existing cleanup_nova() code inadvertently logs out of all iSCSI
connections on the machine because it does not pass the target name
as the -T parameter. This patch changes it to step through the targets
that match the pattern, logging out of each individually, and following
up with a delete op to cleanup the database.

Change-Id: I26c14acbe0e8de18f0e3bf7ad83b37379503e199
"}]
commit_message:
Don't clobber all iSCSI connections during nova cleanup

The existing cleanup_nova() code inadvertently logs out of all iSCSI
connections on the machine because it does not pass the target name
as the -T parameter. This patch changes it to step through the targets
that match the pattern, logging out of each individually, and following
up with a delete op to cleanup the database.

Change-Id: I26c14acbe0e8de18f0e3bf7ad83b37379503e199

[{'created': '2013-03-28 17:29:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix typo in the XML serialization os-services API.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-samples
fixes bug 1130609

The XML serializer for the update method in the os-services API extensions was
not serializing the "updated_at" field because of a typo in the code.
In this change we added api_samples for the XML output.

Change-Id: I9fff0677e9bad650b19e559b3ed6e9bc0ffe8c3c
(cherry picked from commit 48b41e0b880adf80e3be6d128cd392af57b8477e)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix typo in the XML serialization os-services API.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-samples
fixes bug 1130609

The XML serializer for the update method in the os-services API extensions was
not serializing the "updated_at" field because of a typo in the code.
In this change we added api_samples for the XML output.

Change-Id: I9fff0677e9bad650b19e559b3ed6e9bc0ffe8c3c
(cherry picked from commit 48b41e0b880adf80e3be6d128cd392af57b8477e)

[{'created': '2013-03-28 17:47:35.000000000', 'message': "Fix domain database initialization

To fix bug 1089916, calls to db_api.configure_db() were changed to
setup_db_env(). However, the gateway domain initialization didn't get
the memo. This patch makes sure setup_db_env() is called in all the
relevant places.

Fixes bug 1131705.

Change-Id: Ieec141192b8a5a045dadba6d70abaa25748b85b2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix domain database initialization

To fix bug 1089916, calls to db_api.configure_db() were changed to
setup_db_env(). However, the gateway domain initialization didn't get
the memo. This patch makes sure setup_db_env() is called in all the
relevant places.

Fixes bug 1131705.

Change-Id: Ieec141192b8a5a045dadba6d70abaa25748b85b2

two needed modules, socket and time.  In bug 988099 it was noted that
the time module was not being monkey patched.  A test was added that
unfortunately introduced a bug and a patch to revert it is here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25107/ in order to fix bug 1158247.
This patch allows for test_server_monkey_patch.py to be removed
without losing the verification of that functionality.

'}]
commit_message:
Directly verifying that time and socket are monkey patched

This tests makes sure that thew wsgi object properly monkey patched
two needed modules, socket and time.  In bug 988099 it was noted that
the time module was not being monkey patched.  A test was added that
unfortunately introduced a bug and a patch to revert it is here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25107/ in order to fix bug 1158247.
This patch allows for test_server_monkey_patch.py to be removed
without losing the verification of that functionality.

Fixes bug 1158247
Change-Id: I8da6b04d0cc0dae00ba52e5b7350a5e01a76cadb

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-28 17:42:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fallback to inferring image_members unique constraint name

Fixes bug 1160114

The initial version of the 022_image_member_index migration
hardcoded the default naming convention for unqiue constraints
used by PostgreSQL 9.2, which turns out to different to the
convention used by PostgreSQL 8.4. This causes the CI to fail
(non-voting) against RHEL.

We resolve the issue by falling back to inferring the existing
unique constraint name from the image_members indices.

Change-Id: Iad6db033e63cdfd7a77db44bdeaed2284699b469
'}]
commit_message:
Fallback to inferring image_members unique constraint name

Fixes bug 1160114

The initial version of the 022_image_member_index migration
hardcoded the default naming convention for unqiue constraints
used by PostgreSQL 9.2, which turns out to different to the
convention used by PostgreSQL 8.4. This causes the CI to fail
(non-voting) against RHEL.

We resolve the issue by falling back to inferring the existing
unique constraint name from the image_members indices.

Change-Id: Iad6db033e63cdfd7a77db44bdeaed2284699b469

commit_message:
Check if creds are present and not None

Currently, KeystoneStrategy checks whether the required credentials are
present in the creds dict but it doesn't check whether they are valid or
not.

This patch checks whether the required creds are present and not None
otherwise a MissingCredentials exception will be raised.

Note: No need for checking parameters' values types since they'll be
instances of basestring once set otherwise they'll be None.

Fixes bug 1157765

Change-Id: I664a604c3cbf2fca60a88c4d887cd9a4b678c8a5
(cherry picked from commit 855162b0b1fc62b60f0f350d3258334711e12aec)

commit_message:
Message support in SQlite.

 * The JSON serialization is switched to msgpack;
 * list() on messages and stats() on queues fail loudly.

Implements: blueprint message-pagination

Change-Id: Iadb1ef348a53e0de28c6b45782ef686a3f1bf1e2

commit_message:
Use example settings in horizon repo as local_settings.py

The current horizon_settings.py in devstack is out-of-date and we
tend to forget to update this file. This commit changes devstack
to use the example settings in horizon repo.

Change-Id: I0bb6af21a806a72ed59f31b094dd21da85ca335e

Adding HP 3Par Block Storage Driver documentation

Adding a new block storage driver xml file for the HP 3Par iSCSI
and Fibre Channel driver to the Block Storage Admin Guide.

0.7.10 has been released and is compatible with 0.7.x. Instead
of pinning to 0.7.9, simply pin to 0.7.x to avoid SQLAlchemy 0.8

of pinning to 0.7.9, simply pin to 0.7.x to avoid SQLAlchemy 0.8

Also sync the 0.7.x requirements to 0.7.8 (to be in sync with other
OpenStack core components)

Fixes: Bug #1153983

Change-Id: I6f47e7d27fcf0c7271bb2c91a4615ef0bb5e2643

commit_message:
Pin SQLAlchemy to 0.7.x

0.7.10 has been released and is compatible with 0.7.x. Instead
of pinning to 0.7.9, simply pin to 0.7.x to avoid SQLAlchemy 0.8

Also sync the 0.7.x requirements to 0.7.8 (to be in sync with other
OpenStack core components)

Fixes: Bug #1153983

Change-Id: I6f47e7d27fcf0c7271bb2c91a4615ef0bb5e2643

commit_message:
Return 413 when image_size_cap exceeded

HTTP Error 413 (Request entity too large) may be the most appropriate
response when a request to upload an image whose size exceeds
image_size_cap is made.

Addresses bug 1158711.

Change-Id: I4abcb3a8b57c080b5a1b512f9694b2d75a4e5e9d

commit_message:
xenapi: fix support for iso boot

Fixes bug 1154731 that stated the iso support was broken.

There were several issues around a vdis list without a 'root' disk.

Because the ISO boot was HVM, only 0-3 devices will work, so, the
devices used have been re-ordered to ensure ISOs can be read
by a HVM guest without PV tools. Once PV tools are present, a
HVM guest will be able to access an ephemeral or swap disk.

Change-Id: I4b57f70301a4256fa975323d7964fde19e8d4508

commit_message:
Fallback to inferring image_members unique constraint name

Fixes bug 1160114

The initial version of the 022_image_member_index migration
hardcoded the default naming convention for unqiue constraints
used by PostgreSQL 9.2, which turns out to different to the
convention used by PostgreSQL 8.4. This causes the CI to fail
(non-voting) against RHEL.

We resolve the issue by falling back to inferring the existing
unique constraint name from the image_members indices.

Change-Id: Iad6db033e63cdfd7a77db44bdeaed2284699b469

Using insensitive case could tolerate human error. For example,
user maybe set like this "operator_roles = Admin, swiftoperator"

- also fix a mistake in test, ['admin'] is correct value for roles, not
  'admin' (it will be looped as ['a', 'd', 'm', 'i', 'n'])
- add test for insensitive cases

Change-Id: Ib42a21bfcb092306deb7485c199fa2f414dd869c
'}]
commit_message:
Use role in insensitive case in keystoneauth.

Using insensitive case could tolerate human error. For example,
user maybe set like this "operator_roles = Admin, swiftoperator"

- also fix a mistake in test, ['admin'] is correct value for roles, not
  'admin' (it will be looped as ['a', 'd', 'm', 'i', 'n'])
- add test for insensitive cases

Change-Id: Ib42a21bfcb092306deb7485c199fa2f414dd869c

[{'created': '2013-03-28 07:07:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fix the issue in VM launching with quantum port-id

commit 394c693e35 changes allocate_for_instance() return only
info about ports allocated, but we also need to consider the case
where quantum port-id is passed. After this commit allocate_for_instance()
returns new ports created or updated.

Fixes bug 1161211

Change-Id: I24eb74a0506be53d6e2c521377ca1d240c7aa1f5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the issue in VM launching with quantum port-id

commit 394c693e35 changes allocate_for_instance() return only
info about ports allocated, but we also need to consider the case
where quantum port-id is passed. After this commit allocate_for_instance()
returns new ports created or updated.

Fixes bug 1161211

Change-Id: I24eb74a0506be53d6e2c521377ca1d240c7aa1f5

[{'created': '2013-03-28 14:16:51.000000000', 'message': "always quote dhcp-domain, otherwise dnsmasq can fail to start

the dnsmasq arg --dhcp-domain can't be passed to dnsmasq as empty
(i.e. --dhcp-domain= ) unlike many other arguments. If you do pass
it as empty, dnsmasq won't start, throwing a ProcessException which
then crashes the rest of nova-network.

Fix this by quoting dhcp-domain so that empty domains are allowed.

Fixed bug #1161027

This was found by grenade upgrade testing

Change-Id: Id24814339d8c8a709f5041f0aa98b10ba1e0e595
(cherry picked from commit 8d68ed3583df6ced4b4c8b6d6bb3569e03992cfe)
"}]
commit_message:
always quote dhcp-domain, otherwise dnsmasq can fail to start

the dnsmasq arg --dhcp-domain can't be passed to dnsmasq as empty
(i.e. --dhcp-domain= ) unlike many other arguments. If you do pass
it as empty, dnsmasq won't start, throwing a ProcessException which
then crashes the rest of nova-network.

Fix this by quoting dhcp-domain so that empty domains are allowed.

Fixed bug #1161027

This was found by grenade upgrade testing

Change-Id: Id24814339d8c8a709f5041f0aa98b10ba1e0e595
(cherry picked from commit 8d68ed3583df6ced4b4c8b6d6bb3569e03992cfe)

I'm confused here:

The comment says this is fixing 'updated_at' field only.

But you also seem to be nesting the request inside of an extra 'updated' dict. I'm not sure this belongs in this same patch.

Are you actually fixing two different bugs here?"}, {'account_id': 5174, 'date': '2013-03-04 20:10:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

+1 for what dan said... and I don't like the fact of change json current output.. is there another way to go? I mean: I prefer that the xml hierarchy doesn't match json's than change in both (in this case I would fix that in the next api version)."}, {'account_id': 5174, 'date': '2013-03-04 20:16:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

+1 for what dan said... and I don't like the fact of change json current output.. is there another way to go? I mean: Since XML currently doesn't work I prefer that the xml response hierarchy doesn't match json's than change in both (in this case I would fix that in the next api version). I know that's important but I'm following the 'guide' https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/APIChangeGuidelines#Generally_Considered_OK"}, {'account_id': 1865, 'date': '2013-03-05 09:30:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thanks for your comments. @Dan: my first patch was just for fixing the typo but then I got a -1 because of the simple fix was not enough as that bug exposes the lack of proper tests for XML. I totally agreed with that review so I submitted the complete new patch with the bug fixing and the missing XML part. To have this part I had to change the json format of request, I could not change it and write a custom deserializer for the XML requests but it doesn't seem to me the best and right approach. @Mauro I get your point about the API change but in this case the API is not working for XML version and each API should support JSON and XML. In my opinion it is better to have this extension working for both formats before the Grizzly release, even if we have to slightly change the format for JSON requests. Please let me know what do you think."}, {'account_id': 1865, 'date': '2013-03-05 10:06:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Please consider that the complete fix could be useful also for the bug 1104264'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-03-05 21:25:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Andrea:

Looking at this a bit closer today. The os-services extension appears to be rather hosed at the moment. It functionally doesn't work with the existing novaclient implementation and also has a few inconsistencies as well.

See this:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/23616/"}, {'account_id': 5174, 'date': '2013-03-05 23:46:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I'm sorry, I know that I'm being a pain, but I prefer to keep my review.

About the fact that XML doesn't work I would rather prefer an approach like this one https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L924 and make it work in grizzly than change the json response.

What I think about consistency: Consistency issues should be dealt on a new API version, there are people already using this the way it is, and after all APIv3 will come after grizzly. Can we open a bug to make it consistent instead of change json's respose?

If I'm misunderstanding the whole API changes guide in erroneous way, I'll wait until someone explain why this should be accepted the way it is currently and gladly remove my -1"}, {'account_id': 1865, 'date': '2013-03-06 11:22:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

if you agree I can wait for the https://review.openstack.org/#/c/23616/ to get merged (hopefully that will happen shortly) and then update a new patch with complete fix (typo+XML) creating a custom deserializer (https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/hosts.py#L72) in order to not change the response and request format for json.

Please let me know.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-14 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-14 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

commit_message:
Fix typo in the XML serialization os-services API.

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-samples
fixes bug 1130609

The XML serializer for the update method in the os-services API extensions was
not serializing the "updated_at" field because of a typo in the code.
In this change we added api_samples for the XML output.

Change-Id: I9fff0677e9bad650b19e559b3ed6e9bc0ffe8c3c

commit_message:
Don't assume a Parameter value is a str

Currently show_stack and list_stacks will fail for templates
which have a Number in the Parameters.

This should be considered for backport to milestone_proposed.

Change-Id: I1b20babf0998f7714f8bc7bf144e03ff1d7c0c91
Fixes: bug #1160653
(cherry picked from commit b76eb46fdeb3431b5220dd909334ba64b7a2515b)

Do we instead want to remove this option from the array,
by doing something like:

commit_message:
always quote dhcp-domain, otherwise dnsmasq can fail to start

the dnsmasq arg --dhcp-domain can't be passed to dnsmasq as empty
(i.e. --dhcp-domain= ) unlike many other arguments. If you do pass
it as empty, dnsmasq won't start, throwing a ProcessException which
then crashes the rest of nova-network.

Fix this by quoting dhcp-domain so that empty domains are allowed.

Fixed bug #1161027

This was found by grenade upgrade testing

Change-Id: Id24814339d8c8a709f5041f0aa98b10ba1e0e595

Commit 4c34f5f1e8c66e4a865cf7996b283509feb91b71 introduced a
regression making it impossible to add a security group to
an existing instance.

In the javascript membership module, make sure new members are still
assigned the default role even if the role dropdown is not displayed
(as is the case for the instance security group add/remove view).

Fixes bug 1158037.

Change-Id: I986f7296e97a08d5e9141fe0739d4e028e066fc1
(cherry picked from commit 64c0ddfa7a5189d4523a31d78cd97dc1ea2151a1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix adding security groups to an existing instance

Commit 4c34f5f1e8c66e4a865cf7996b283509feb91b71 introduced a
regression making it impossible to add a security group to
an existing instance.

In the javascript membership module, make sure new members are still
assigned the default role even if the role dropdown is not displayed
(as is the case for the instance security group add/remove view).

Fixes bug 1158037.

Change-Id: I986f7296e97a08d5e9141fe0739d4e028e066fc1
(cherry picked from commit 64c0ddfa7a5189d4523a31d78cd97dc1ea2151a1)

commit_message:
Add missing tests for db.instance_type_access_* methods

There was no tests in test_db_api for instance_type_access_* methods.

Add tests to ensure that all works.
Also these tests allow us to refactor these methods.
For example add missing unique constraint on columns
(instance_type_id, project_id)

blueprint db-api-tests

Change-Id: Idfeda1685ef8c812c1211783aede15795b0d7caf

commit_message:
Remove race condition (in InstanceTypes)

Soft delete all duplicate rows with the same name except one with
the biggest value in `id` column.

Soft delete all duplicate rows with the same flavorid except one with
the biggest value in `id` column.

Create UC on columns (name, deleted) and (flavorid, deleted)

Replace Select then Insert -> Try to Insert.

blueprint db-enforce-unique-keys

Change-Id: If66d2f1387c2b2748784bf7ac9746b8d755b70a9

commit_message:
Fix quantum nic allocation when only portid is specified

A simple omission at the end of allocate_for_instance() was preventing
the function from returning information about the newly-allocated port
if one was not actually allocated from a network (i.e. if it was
provided as input). This fixes that and adds a test which would have
caught it.

Fixes bug 1160560

(cherry-picked from 57689f26f37fe3de33a666a2d7d0731eae9c7ea9)

Change-Id: Ib0d7d91acfe5bd684cdfc072fe47c8115c2f91b3

In order to expose historical usage information about instances that
were deleted at the time migration #153 was run, we need to fall back
to looking up type information by instance_type_id.

This patch does that (only for deleted instances) and replicates the
previous behavior of skipping instances that have an instance_type_id
that points to a non-existent type.

Fixes bug 1161022

(cherry-picked from 30631d0077424001e2fa57674e6e9f2a12f0683e)

Change-Id: I39d30c59d1711d8f2a61c7a5e2545b3952e55dbe
'}]
commit_message:
Make tenant_usage fall back to instance_type_id

In order to expose historical usage information about instances that
were deleted at the time migration #153 was run, we need to fall back
to looking up type information by instance_type_id.

This patch does that (only for deleted instances) and replicates the
previous behavior of skipping instances that have an instance_type_id
that points to a non-existent type.

Fixes bug 1161022

(cherry-picked from 30631d0077424001e2fa57674e6e9f2a12f0683e)

Change-Id: I39d30c59d1711d8f2a61c7a5e2545b3952e55dbe

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-27 21:47:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix quantum nic allocation when only portid is specified

A simple omission at the end of allocate_for_instance() was preventing
the function from returning information about the newly-allocated port
if one was not actually allocated from a network (i.e. if it was
provided as input). This fixes that and adds a test which would have
caught it.

Fixes bug 1160560

Change-Id: Ib0d7d91acfe5bd684cdfc072fe47c8115c2f91b3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix quantum nic allocation when only portid is specified

A simple omission at the end of allocate_for_instance() was preventing
the function from returning information about the newly-allocated port
if one was not actually allocated from a network (i.e. if it was
provided as input). This fixes that and adds a test which would have
caught it.

Fixes bug 1160560

Change-Id: Ib0d7d91acfe5bd684cdfc072fe47c8115c2f91b3

In order to expose historical usage information about instances that
were deleted at the time migration #153 was run, we need to fall back
to looking up type information by instance_type_id.

This patch does that (only for deleted instances) and replicates the
previous behavior of skipping instances that have an instance_type_id
that points to a non-existent type.

Fixes bug 1161022

Change-Id: I39d30c59d1711d8f2a61c7a5e2545b3952e55dbe
'}]
commit_message:
Make tenant_usage fall back to instance_type_id

In order to expose historical usage information about instances that
were deleted at the time migration #153 was run, we need to fall back
to looking up type information by instance_type_id.

This patch does that (only for deleted instances) and replicates the
previous behavior of skipping instances that have an instance_type_id
that points to a non-existent type.

Fixes bug 1161022

Change-Id: I39d30c59d1711d8f2a61c7a5e2545b3952e55dbe

Resolves bug 1013893 by allowing the setting of the iptables drop
action with a configuration flag. It is expected that this would be
used for run a LOGDROP action before actually dropping the packet.

DocImpact: the drop action for iptables rules can now be configured

commit_message:
Make iptables drop action configurable.

Resolves bug 1013893 by allowing the setting of the iptables drop
action with a configuration flag. It is expected that this would be
used for run a LOGDROP action before actually dropping the packet.

DocImpact: the drop action for iptables rules can now be configured
for nova-network users with the iptables_drop_action flag.

Change-Id: I15720d2742955611929a4d7181a269795296e025

commit_message:
Rework time handling in periodic tasks.

Update time calculations in the periodic task handling to use the
timeutils module from oslo. This provides benefits for unit testing,
since we can easily override the time functions to simulate time
differences without having to actually sleep and make the unit tests
run unnecessarily long.

Resolves bug 1098979.

Change-Id: I1e6a0a0b1622a3f8c37c42376f5261f5f2dbf6fe

sometimes it will fail. This patch provides the network netmask
to dnsmasq via the --dhcp-range argument.

Change-Id: I74d62c837b5310004b9151851697e3ea3b475f92

commit_message:
Adding netmask to dnsmasq argument --dhcp-range

By default, dnsmasq will try to guess the proper subnet size but
sometimes it will fail. This patch provides the network netmask
to dnsmasq via the --dhcp-range argument.

Fixes: bug #1154929

Change-Id: I74d62c837b5310004b9151851697e3ea3b475f92
(cherry picked from commit fb151b5e3704c9a293f10ba89abc14f83d803c24)

commit_message:
Use format_message on exceptions instead of str()

This patch changes all usages of unicode() and str() in the API layer
(and most other reasonable places) into a new format_message method.
This is done in order to avoid leaking the stack trace back to the
user through the Remote excepitons.

This patch deliberately avoids the EC2 api as the way how the EC2 API
handles responses is being worked on as part of another blueprint.

Fixes bug 1159755

Change-Id: I04a74682c4fac9a66ba25b52fd5c7af5e10e81e8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-28 02:27:15.000000000', 'message': 'Add a format_message method to the Exceptions

This patch adds a format_message method to the NovaException class that
will almost always do what a user wants, when they want to print out the
message of the exception.

Exceptions that are received through RPC are turned into an actual
exception classes by the deserialize_remote_exception function of the
nova.openstack.common.rpc.common module. This function then overrides
__str__ and __unicode__ methods of a new class to print the whole trace.
We still want to preserve this functionality (for logging) but do not
want to leak the trace back to the user in the HTTP response.

Based on the above, This patch attempts to establish a convention that
states: if you need to get the message of a NovaException subclass -
always use the format_message method. Only use str(e) or unicode(e) when
you suspect that they were overriden.

Initially this was attempted through adding a custom metaclass to the
NovaException class so that format_message cannot be overridden in
subclasses, however due to a bug in testtools - many tests were failing.
A patch was proposed to testtols to remedy this
(https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/pull/34) however until it is
merged, we cannot use metaclasses with our exception classes as they
cause tests to fail.

Change-Id: I0a399b9ab3227bad644b031c9b689fe0ce64586e
(cherry picked from commit b936df8c1ec47300540403ebb6833f0fbf5f195f)
'}]
commit_message:
Add a format_message method to the Exceptions

This patch adds a format_message method to the NovaException class that
will almost always do what a user wants, when they want to print out the
message of the exception.

Exceptions that are received through RPC are turned into an actual
exception classes by the deserialize_remote_exception function of the
nova.openstack.common.rpc.common module. This function then overrides
__str__ and __unicode__ methods of a new class to print the whole trace.
We still want to preserve this functionality (for logging) but do not
want to leak the trace back to the user in the HTTP response.

Based on the above, This patch attempts to establish a convention that
states: if you need to get the message of a NovaException subclass -
always use the format_message method. Only use str(e) or unicode(e) when
you suspect that they were overriden.

Initially this was attempted through adding a custom metaclass to the
NovaException class so that format_message cannot be overridden in
subclasses, however due to a bug in testtools - many tests were failing.
A patch was proposed to testtols to remedy this
(https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/pull/34) however until it is
merged, we cannot use metaclasses with our exception classes as they
cause tests to fail.

Change-Id: I0a399b9ab3227bad644b031c9b689fe0ce64586e
(cherry picked from commit b936df8c1ec47300540403ebb6833f0fbf5f195f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-28 09:52:36.000000000', 'message': 'heat engine : Autoscaling reload Loadbalancer correctly

Since the change implemented as part of bug #1136148 we no longer
wait for nova to create the instance before reloading the loadbalancer
which means we race nova assigning an IP to the instance and typically
the loadbalancer config ends up with the 0.0.0.0 default value
which the loadbalancer implementation uses when nova returns no IP.

This patch moves the LB reload into a separate function, which is called
after instances are active on group creation or adjustment

Since our loadbalancer is broken without this fix, this is a candidate
for backporting to grizzly milestone-proposed.

fixes bug #1160407

Change-Id: I50423883dead9a615aa79b8765d5480a9345686d
'}]
commit_message:
heat engine : Autoscaling reload Loadbalancer correctly

Since the change implemented as part of bug #1136148 we no longer
wait for nova to create the instance before reloading the loadbalancer
which means we race nova assigning an IP to the instance and typically
the loadbalancer config ends up with the 0.0.0.0 default value
which the loadbalancer implementation uses when nova returns no IP.

This patch moves the LB reload into a separate function, which is called
after instances are active on group creation or adjustment

Since our loadbalancer is broken without this fix, this is a candidate
for backporting to grizzly milestone-proposed.

fixes bug #1160407

Change-Id: I50423883dead9a615aa79b8765d5480a9345686d

commit_message:
Make swift FnGetAtt fault tolerant and block less

head_container is now only called for required attributes
and will tolerate failure if there is an issue with the underlying
container.

This was preventing deleting of stacks with swift resources.

Possibly this is eligible for backporting to milestone-proposed.

Change-Id: I2f489126957f11924943955a7f63a2ebc45f1911
Fixes: bug #1160584

commit_message:
Don't assume a Parameter value is a str

Currently show_stack and list_stacks will fail for templates
which have a Number in the Parameters.

This should be considered for backport to milestone_proposed.

Change-Id: I1b20babf0998f7714f8bc7bf144e03ff1d7c0c91
Fixes: bug #1160653

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-27 16:40:27.000000000', 'message': 'heat engine : Autoscaling reload Loadbalancer correctly

Since the change implemented as part of bug #1136148 we no longer
wait for nova to create the instance before reloading the loadbalancer
which means we race nova assigning an IP to the instance and typically
the loadbalancer config ends up with the 0.0.0.0 default value
which the loadbalancer implementation uses when nova returns no IP.

This patch moves the LB reload into a separate function, which is called
after instances are active on group creation or adjustment

Since our loadbalancer is broken without this fix, this is a candidate
for backporting to grizzly milestone-proposed.

fixes bug #1160407

Change-Id: I50423883dead9a615aa79b8765d5480a9345686d
'}, {'created': '2013-03-28 08:02:23.000000000', 'message': 'heat engine : Autoscaling reload Loadbalancer correctly

Since the change implemented as part of bug #1136148 we no longer
wait for nova to create the instance before reloading the loadbalancer
which means we race nova assigning an IP to the instance and typically
the loadbalancer config ends up with the 0.0.0.0 default value
which the loadbalancer implementation uses when nova returns no IP.

This patch moves the LB reload into a separate function, which is called
after instances are active on group creation or adjustment

Since our loadbalancer is broken without this fix, this is a candidate
for backporting to grizzly milestone-proposed.

fixes bug #1160407

Change-Id: I50423883dead9a615aa79b8765d5480a9345686d
'}]
commit_message:
heat engine : Autoscaling reload Loadbalancer correctly

Since the change implemented as part of bug #1136148 we no longer
wait for nova to create the instance before reloading the loadbalancer
which means we race nova assigning an IP to the instance and typically
the loadbalancer config ends up with the 0.0.0.0 default value
which the loadbalancer implementation uses when nova returns no IP.

This patch moves the LB reload into a separate function, which is called
after instances are active on group creation or adjustment

Since our loadbalancer is broken without this fix, this is a candidate
for backporting to grizzly milestone-proposed.

fixes bug #1160407

Change-Id: I50423883dead9a615aa79b8765d5480a9345686d

commit_message:
Enable exception format checking when testing.

Updates our new exception base class to enable exception
format checking. This should help enforce that we pass
the correct kwargs to exceptions when testing.

Change-Id: I9ac62e289c0de3931861473912bb6c98b57d4126

Change the quantum-ns-metadata-proxy log file name.

Add a '-' before the router_id/network_id for easier parsing
when starting the ns metadata proxy.

Fixes bug 1161124

Change-Id: I408111d1343ecac297f6277e8067d3fa34bb8cb7

commit_message:
Prevents a portinfo deletion in vm migration with NEC plugin.

Fixes: Bug 1160193

This patch prevents a portinfo deletion at the end of the migration sequence
by ignoring port_removed message from source host.

subject: Add NUMA cell count to the cpu_info attribute
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 24, 'name': 'Chuck Short', 'email': 'charles.short@windriver.com', 'username': 'zulcss'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 3189, 'name': 'Chet Burgess', 'email': 'cfb@metacloud.com', 'username': 'cfb-n'}, {'_account_id': 5280, 'name': 'Nicolas Simonds', 'email': 'nic@metacloud.com', 'username': 'nicolas.simonds'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-18 07:12:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/24631/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/23143 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24631/1/check/gate-nova-docs/17496 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24631/1/check/gate-nova-python26/18905 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24631/1/check/gate-nova-python27/18993 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24631/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/9307 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24631/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/9023 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24631/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/14661 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24631/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/9553 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-03-18 13:53:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-18 14:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

The bug is short on information about what current functionality is broken, which makes it hard to decide whether this proposed fix is actually suitable or not. Your fix is implying that the existing 'sockets' field is 'sockets per numa node', but I'm not sure this has ever been clearly defined. It could easily be considered to be 'sockets per host' instead.

Code that would calculate total sockets by doing  "numa cells * sockets per cell" is architecturally doomed because  it is assuming that every numa node has the same number of CPUs. This is absolutely not valid in general. So I'm not really convinced that just adding a 'numa_cells' count is satisfactory.

We need more info in the bug report to clarify what the real world problem is, so we can decide on best solution.'}, {'account_id': 5280, 'date': '2013-03-18 17:51:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Our short-term goal is just to be able to detect NUMA nodes.  Our longer-term goal is to add a NUMA-aware scheduler to Nova.

This approach was selected because it is simple, and adds an extra data point without impeding any other functionality (and gets us what we need).

An alternate approach would be to represent the NUMA cell structure as presented by libvirt, and we are willing to take that approach instead if it would be considered more acceptable.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-18 17:56:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, so this really isn't a bug fix at all then, this all new feature work masquerading as a bug fix. As such I think this needs to have a formal blueprint with detailed specification provided about dealing with NUMA in Nova & its shcedular. We definitely don't want to be just outputting a single 'numa cells' count since this just leads to brokenness when you consider asymmetric NUMA topologies."}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-18 18:44:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

+1 to dealing this in havana"}, {'account_id': 3189, 'date': '2013-03-18 18:50:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I can accept that doing something intelligent with NUMA should be a blueprint for havana, however I'm not entirely sure that there isn't also a bug here.

On a dual socket Intel Xeon E5-2650 system the topology being reported via nova is the following.

"topology": {"cores": "8", "threads": "2", "sockets": "1"}

This is accurate in that it is what is reported via the getCapabilities call, but it is not accurate from the perspective of what is physically present on the system. So I believe we still need to fix this in some way to properly report on NUMA systems. 3rd party software that is trying to rely on the API can't get an accurate representation of what is physically present today.

I assume (and Daniel please correct me if I am wrong) that libvirt reports that based upon the understanding that this is per NUMA cell? Or is this a case were we need a newer version of libvirt that properly reports on a NUMA system? We don't have any asymmetric NUMA systems to look at so I don't know how its presented in the asymmetric case. What would be the correct way of reporting the number of cores, threads, and sockets on a NUMA based system, without representing the entire NUMA topology?'}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2013-03-18 19:02:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-18 19:10:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@chet  historically libvirt has had a 'virDomainGetNodeInfo' API which returned '(nodes-per-host,sockets-per-node,cores-per-socket,threads-per-core)' and to calculate the total CPUs people were to multiply those values together. This API & approach is deprecated because it is broken by design for any NUMA topology which is not symmetrical, which is becoming increasingly common.

If there is a use case for providing the total number of CPUs on a Nova host, then we should expose this total CPU count explicitly.

Similarly if there is a use case for NUMA topology, then we should expose that.

What we should not do, is follow the broken design that Libvirt has deprecated of exposing individual nodes/sockets/cores/threads and expect people to multiple them together to get total CPU count."}, {'account_id': 5280, 'date': '2013-03-19 16:21:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If you're saying that the only acceptable solution is to expose the NUMA topology, then that is fine, we'll draft a blueprint and pitch it for Havana.

But at a minimum, the fix for this bug in Grizzly should be an entry in the Errata stating that CPU counts out of the Nova API are going inaccurate on NUMA nodes."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-19 16:22:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If you want a solution for Grizzly too, then I'd support adding a "total_cpus" value to the data, since this avoids any need for apps to be doing the bogus calculations I describe.'}, {'account_id': 5280, 'date': '2013-03-19 16:52:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

In one of our specific use cases, we're after the total socket count on the host, so a total_cpus value would not help us, whereas the additional data provided in this patch set, would.

The idea behind the provided patch isn't to canonically solve the CPU counting problem for Grizzly, it is just to provide an extra datapoint to tell apps using this API data that they might need to do extra work to get the answers they need from the Nova API.  It has the (beneficial to us) side-effect of being all the information one needs to count CPUs on symmetric NUMA systems, but the desired end result is for it to simply be extra data that doesn't get in the way of anything else Nova is doing."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-20 09:52:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> In one of our specific use cases, we're after the total 
> socket count on the host, so a total_cpus value would not
> help us, whereas the additional data provided in this patch
> set, would.

No, if you use the data from this patch you would be getting a "total sockets" count that is known to be incorrect on some portion of hardware. 

If "total cpus" is not what you need, then jn addition to tha,t we could also provide an accurate "total sockets" value.'}, {'account_id': 5280, 'date': '2013-03-20 17:17:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We just want to know through the Nova API if the compute node we're looking at is a NUMA node, and if so, how many cells it has.  That's why the patch does what it does.  If we wanted to do something like create a NUMA-aware scheduler (hint: we do) a datapoint such as this one is very useful, whereas counting out the CPUs/sockets/threads/power supplies/number of USB blades is not.

I'm at a bit of a loss.  I get that you find the proposed approach unacceptable, and I get why you do, but I do not get what you propose to do instead that would be possible to get into Grizzly.

Tell me how you would like to see the problem of "detecting NUMA nodes with the Nova API" solved in a manner that would be acceptable for Grizzly, and I'll happily implement it.  Papering over our individual use cases seems wrong-headed, and denying that there's a problem at all seems silly.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-20 17:29:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> We just want to know through the Nova API if the compute node
> we're looking at is a NUMA node, and if so, how many cells it has.


> Tell me how you would like to see the problem of "detecting NUMA nodes
> with the Nova API" solved in a manner that would be acceptable for Grizzly,
> and I'll happily implement it. Papering over our individual use cases seems
> wrong-headed, and denying that there's a problem at all seems silly.

I'm trying to understand what the actual end goals here are, so we can figure out what the right solution is to those goals. You've previously stated that the reason you want to know the NUMA node count, is to allow you to calculate the total number of sockets. The proposed fix here is not a good solution for that goal, for the reasons stated earlier. Reporting a "total sockets" value would address that stated goal. I don't consider that to be papering over use cases - on the contrary, I'm trying to ensure we get the optimal solution for that use case, instead of one we know to be flawed. If you have other use cases you are trying to address, beyond just figuring out the total number of sockets, please describe what they are.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-28 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-28 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-28 03:26:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix guest sql_connection configuration error

* The guestagent.conf was being updated with the $ADMIN_PASSWORD
  variable instead of the DB password.
* Causes guest to fail to connect to DB on startup

fixes bug 1161157

Change-Id: I2bc5a2db6c92c10ad182ed68e1eb870792bfcfb6
'}]
commit_message:
Fix guest sql_connection configuration error

* The guestagent.conf was being updated with the $ADMIN_PASSWORD
  variable instead of the DB password.
* Causes guest to fail to connect to DB on startup

fixes bug 1161157

Change-Id: I2bc5a2db6c92c10ad182ed68e1eb870792bfcfb6

Remove impl_test

commit_message:
Refactor DB tests

This is a big change but a necessary one. It moves all the database
connection stuff, even for test purpose, in
ceilometer.storage.impl_<backend> rather than redeclaring stuff inside the
tests.db module. That means less code and the possibility to run the API
test against various database backends for free.

Change-Id: I5e2ae2a2628de0d1e105c9d525c510fd356295d4
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Adding netmask to dnsmasq argument --dhcp-range

By default, dnsmasq will try to guess the proper subnet size but
sometimes it will fail. This patch provides the network netmask
to dnsmasq via the --dhcp-range argument.

Fixes: bug #1154929

Change-Id: I74d62c837b5310004b9151851697e3ea3b475f92

In ops manual: when running a daemon from the CLI, run as the
appropriate user (e.g., glance, nova, keystone) instead of as root.

This will catch incorrect permission errors that wouldn't appear when
running as root.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/25240

Change-Id: Iccc112cf69de5c9d2c96dce2dd27e804ae5f7b8e
"}]
commit_message:
Run daemons as appropriate user

In ops manual: when running a daemon from the CLI, run as the
appropriate user (e.g., glance, nova, keystone) instead of as root.

This will catch incorrect permission errors that wouldn't appear when
running as root.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/25240

Change-Id: Iccc112cf69de5c9d2c96dce2dd27e804ae5f7b8e

commit_message:
Add doc support for Extended Availabiliy Zone

This extension adds info about the instance
availability zone to the Compute API output.

Fixes: bug 1128563
Change-Id: I78a6566f0f95620ff3eb4cc638198778db2af7c6

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-22 21:11:37.000000000', 'message': 'security groups dropped if configuration error

If the machine running nova-api sets security_group_api=quantum
and the machines running nova-compute does not set security_group_api=quantum
the security groups passed in via nova boot are dropped when the port is
created the nova-compute host.

This patch fixes this by removing the check if running
quantum security groups and passes the requested security groups regardlessly
to allocate_for_instance(). The result is even if security_group_api is
not set to quantum on the nova-compute hosts the requested security groups
will still be applied.

Fixes bug 1158985

Change-Id: I7752282bc6b82943a50c0cb7cd99381e7ab2ed49
'}]
commit_message:
security groups dropped if configuration error

If the machine running nova-api sets security_group_api=quantum
and the machines running nova-compute does not set security_group_api=quantum
the security groups passed in via nova boot are dropped when the port is
created the nova-compute host.

This patch fixes this by removing the check if running
quantum security groups and passes the requested security groups regardlessly
to allocate_for_instance(). The result is even if security_group_api is
not set to quantum on the nova-compute hosts the requested security groups
will still be applied.

Fixes bug 1158985

Change-Id: I7752282bc6b82943a50c0cb7cd99381e7ab2ed49

I'm going to merge in the service.show() api call in here, and drop the service.version() call, but keep the DB changes in there. So I'm gonna merge in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20497/"}, {'account_id': 4419, 'date': '2013-02-18 21:57:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thanks Mauro,

You brought up a good point with:

> also why not just include the version as attribute on service get ?

the reason was originally because the version was gotten via rpc, rather than from the DB, but now it's in the DB too, so no reason to have two different methods.

...

I'll merge this patch (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/20497/) into here, adding the 'service.show()' method, and dropping the 'service.version()' method.

...

I'm planning to add another method to get the service's configuration settings later, I'll probably include those in the service show too."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-18 23:16:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Regarding the addition of the ID:

 * As a sysadmin, I'd like to see as much info as possible about what's in the system without having to ssh into servers; is there a compelling reason for hiding the ID ?
    + With the ID, I can be more sure that I'm talking about the same service in the api, as in the DB
 * As there is no unique index in the DB on host+binary, it could be possible to have a DB corruption with the dups in; having the ID would help the sysadmin be more specific"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-02-21 01:47:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

"}, {'created': '2013-02-20 02:40:10.000000000', 'message': "Adds 'id' and 'version' to services list in api

 * The service object updates the DB when it starts up with the code
   version that it's running
 * The services openstack api extension now reports the 'version' and
   'id' db fields when listing services

 * The 'id' is needed to properly identify a service, using host name
   and binary-name might not be unique enough
 * We may add more service api methods later, that will need
   addressing by ID. eg. service_get, service_config
 * Cells support should be added later, in that case the 'id' is like
   'path!to!cell@42' (where 42 is the ID)

DocImpact

commit_message:
Adds 'version' and 'created_at' fields to services list in api

 * The service object updates the DB when it starts up with the code
   version that it's running
 * The services openstack api extension now reports the 'version'
   db field when listing services

DocImpact

Change-Id: I9f3131bbc3c218bedb41d491d54ca5102a6a4353
Implements: blueprint service-api-extension-upgrade1

'}, {'account_id': 4463, 'date': '2013-03-25 00:01:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 1390, 'date': '2013-03-25 11:43:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Mark, thanks for adding this fix.  

My only concern is that we don't have a test for this?  It seems the configure_db vs setup_db_env situation requires prior knowledge of the problems associated with initializing a db engine before forking worker processes, and would be an easy mistake to make again."}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-03-25 13:03:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hey Paul,

AFAICT, configure_db was being used in that gateway.py file and the difference between it and the setup_db_env is that it call's the later itself and also calls get_engine. There's a really small test for get_engine that ensures it fails on bad connections.

While I agree on the fact that both functions could be tested a bit better I also think they've been tested by testing other db_api functions.

I'd also suggest to call both, setup_db_Env and get_engine, functions separated in order to keep the later as lazy as possible.

@mark Should we remove configure_db? By replacing it in gateway.py with setup_db_env, this function wont be used in other places besides tests.

Grep:

(glance)phantom: glance-registry/glance/glance $ grep -r configure_db ./                                                                                                                                                      
./db/simple/api.py:def configure_db(*args, **kwargs):
./db/sqlalchemy/api.py:def configure_db():
./gateway.py:        self.db_api.configure_db()
./tests/functional/db/test_sqlalchemy.py:    db_api.configure_db()
./tests/functional/db/test_registry.py:    sql_api.configure_db()
./tests/functional/db/test_registry.py:    db_api.configure_db()
./tests/unit/test_clients.py:        db_api.configure_db()
./tests/unit/v1/test_api.py:        db_api.configure_db()
./tests/unit/v1/test_api.py:        db_api.configure_db()"}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-03-25 13:04:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

erm, it looks like gerrit doesn't like those new lines!

Well, the grep just showed that it's being used in gateway.py and tests!

Cheers!
FF"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-03-25 18:17:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yes, let's work on removing all references to configure_db() if possible.

But if we do that cleanup in a separate patch, it may be easier to backport this change to grizzly."}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-03-25 19:58:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is a test for this kind of thing possible?  Perhaps functional tests should be created to run with multiple workers.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-03-27 22:22:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Perhaps the right way to test this is to change the functional tests to kick off a  worker, rather than a whole server. That way, we can ensure that the worker can function without providing it a db connection.

But I'd really like to backport or rc2 this fix, so the kind of refactoring I'm thinking of would not make sense in that context."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-03-27 22:43:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-27 22:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-22 22:23:53.000000000', 'message': "Fix domain database initialization

To fix bug 1089916, calls to db_api.configure_db() were changed to
setup_db_env(). However, the gateway domain initialization didn't get
the memo. This patch makes sure setup_db_env() is called in all the
relevant places.

Fixes bug 1131705.

Change-Id: Ieec141192b8a5a045dadba6d70abaa25748b85b2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix domain database initialization

To fix bug 1089916, calls to db_api.configure_db() were changed to
setup_db_env(). However, the gateway domain initialization didn't get
the memo. This patch makes sure setup_db_env() is called in all the
relevant places.

Fixes bug 1131705.

Change-Id: Ieec141192b8a5a045dadba6d70abaa25748b85b2

commit_message:
Directly verifying that time and socket are monkey patched

This tests makes sure that thew wsgi object properly monkey patched
two needed modules, socket and time.  In bug 988099 it was noted that
the time module was not being monkey patched.  A test was added that
unfortunately introduced a bug and a patch to revert it is here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25107/ in order to fix bug 1158247.
This patch allows for test_server_monkey_patch.py to be removed
without losing the verification of that functionality.

Fixes bug 1158247
Change-Id: I8da6b04d0cc0dae00ba52e5b7350a5e01a76cadb

commit_message:
Use format_message on exceptions instead of str()

This patch changes all usages of unicode() and str() in the API layer
(and most other reasonable places) into a new format_message method.
This is done in order to avoid leaking the stack trace back to the
user through the Remote excepitons.

This patch deliberately avoids the EC2 api as the way how the EC2 API
handles responses is being worked on as part of another blueprint.

Fixes bug 1159755

Change-Id: I04a74682c4fac9a66ba25b52fd5c7af5e10e81e8

I wonder, though, if a better implementation would be to have the remote exceptions include a 'traceback' attribute that had the formal traceback.  Then, we alter the exception logging formatter to draw its traceback from the attribute if one is set…"}, {'account_id': 5441, 'date': '2013-03-26 20:47:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

I think there are a lot of ways this can go, so I'm making a suggestion about an alternative but not too concerned with it atm.  I'm -1 due to the interpolation question."}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-03-26 21:32:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-03-26 21:41:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I am going to look into Kevin's idea a bit more tomorrow (too late here now), as it seems like it could give us what we want with very little change (which was the idea behind this patch), however if it turns out that there are (many) places that rely on remote exceptions responding to str() with a trace, I believe this kind of approach would still be preferable. 

I personally like the explicitness of format_message.

Andrew's idea with an exception class in Oslo (OpenStackException?) seems cool but having in mind the current state of Oslo, and that we are not using all of it in Nova, I'd keep it as a future fix?

Cheers for the thoughts guys!"}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-03-26 22:01:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-03-27 14:53:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I like Kevin's idea.  While I appreciate what this patch is intended to do, it feels 
like we should modify the deserialize_remote behavior to not stomp on __str__ and __unicode__..."}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-03-27 16:12:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-03-27 16:23:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2013-03-27 16:27:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hey Brian,

I've spent a few hours staring at logging and exception handling code in nova, and I honestly think this is the solution we should go for at this point. Here's my thinking

1) format_message on Nova exceptions is quite explicit, and as such does not feel hacky to me (so is having a remote_trace attribute, but this brings us to #2)

2) Logging is a bigger surface area than API responses, and people tend to be more security conscious when putting text into those (info leaks, XSS vulns etc. made developers a bit more aware about stuff like this).

3) Logging is usually called just by sending it formatted strings at the moment, so there is no quick win there either without refactoring, that I would steer clear at this point in the release cycle. We run a risk of swallowing traces if we mess with the overridden str/unicode methods.

Based on the above I would keep it like this for now and do a more serious audit of logging and change the way it's done when exceptions are in question."}, {'account_id': 2835, 'date': '2013-03-27 16:31:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I can live with that.  Thanks for doing some analysis on it.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-27 16:33:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-26 13:37:17.000000000', 'message': 'Add a format_message method to the Exceptions

This patch adds a format_message method to the NovaException class that
will almost always do what a user wants, when they want to print out the
message of the exception.

Exceptions that are received through RPC are turned into an actual
exception classes by the deserialize_remote_exception function of the
nova.openstack.common.rpc.common module. This function then overrides
__str__ and __unicode__ methods of a new class to print the whole trace.
We still want to preserve this functionality (for logging) but do not
want to leak the trace back to the user in the HTTP response.

Based on the above, This patch attempts to establish a convention that
states: if you need to get the message of a NovaException subclass -
always use the format_message method. Only use str(e) or unicode(e) when
you suspect that they were overriden.

Initially this was attempted through adding a custom metaclass to the
NovaException class so that format_message cannot be overridden in
subclasses, however due to a bug in testtools - many tests were failing.
A patch was proposed to testtols to remedy this
(https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/pull/34) however until it is
merged, we cannot use metaclasses with our exception classes as they
cause tests to fail.

Change-Id: I0a399b9ab3227bad644b031c9b689fe0ce64586e
'}, {'created': '2013-03-27 16:12:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add a format_message method to the Exceptions

This patch adds a format_message method to the NovaException class that
will almost always do what a user wants, when they want to print out the
message of the exception.

Exceptions that are received through RPC are turned into an actual
exception classes by the deserialize_remote_exception function of the
nova.openstack.common.rpc.common module. This function then overrides
__str__ and __unicode__ methods of a new class to print the whole trace.
We still want to preserve this functionality (for logging) but do not
want to leak the trace back to the user in the HTTP response.

Based on the above, This patch attempts to establish a convention that
states: if you need to get the message of a NovaException subclass -
always use the format_message method. Only use str(e) or unicode(e) when
you suspect that they were overriden.

Initially this was attempted through adding a custom metaclass to the
NovaException class so that format_message cannot be overridden in
subclasses, however due to a bug in testtools - many tests were failing.
A patch was proposed to testtols to remedy this
(https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/pull/34) however until it is

commit_message:
Add a format_message method to the Exceptions

This patch adds a format_message method to the NovaException class that
will almost always do what a user wants, when they want to print out the
message of the exception.

Exceptions that are received through RPC are turned into an actual
exception classes by the deserialize_remote_exception function of the
nova.openstack.common.rpc.common module. This function then overrides
__str__ and __unicode__ methods of a new class to print the whole trace.
We still want to preserve this functionality (for logging) but do not
want to leak the trace back to the user in the HTTP response.

Based on the above, This patch attempts to establish a convention that
states: if you need to get the message of a NovaException subclass -
always use the format_message method. Only use str(e) or unicode(e) when
you suspect that they were overriden.

Initially this was attempted through adding a custom metaclass to the
NovaException class so that format_message cannot be overridden in
subclasses, however due to a bug in testtools - many tests were failing.
A patch was proposed to testtols to remedy this
(https://github.com/testing-cabal/testtools/pull/34) however until it is
merged, we cannot use metaclasses with our exception classes as they
cause tests to fail.

Change-Id: I0a399b9ab3227bad644b031c9b689fe0ce64586e
