I'm somewhat torn here. The changes you are making are functionally different, but I know it shouldn't hurt anything. I want to see what Mark thinks before landing this."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-02-28 18:58:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

I really don't like overloading boolean values, so I only think we should do it when it strongly improves the readability of code."}, {'account_id': 5718, 'date': '2013-03-01 01:49:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

it is a programming recommendation of PEP8 to use the fact that empy sequences are false although PEP8 does not check that'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-03-01 03:58:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Well, you have me there. Sorry if I am over-reacting--this is just one of my pet peeves, and I'd sooner it wasn't even a feature of the language.

I am confused by pep8's recommendations. It says  "For sequences, (strings, lists, tuples), use the fact that empty sequences are false." However, python is a duck-typed object-oriented language, so I cannot be sure in every piece of code that the object I'm using as a sequence truly is a string, list, or tuple. It could instead be some object that implements only part of the sequence interface.

To top it off, using the fact that "if x:" does all sorts of magic with __nonzero__ and __len__ feels like it falls afoul of the admonishment that "Explicit is better than implicit." (PEP 20)

Now, I do not feel like this philosophy of mine is sufficient cause to root out all the implicit "if X:" statements in the code. But neither do I feel particularly motivated that we should do the opposite, as you have proposed here.

At least until Havana opens ;-)'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-03-01 19:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-03-04 18:14:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Personally, I'm not against these changes. They're are not harmful and make code more readable, imho."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-03-04 18:18:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Yes, honestly I certainly wouldn't have objected if the code had been written with these changes to begin with.

Sorry again for overreacting. I think my language frustrations are better left out the review process."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-03-06 00:38:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

In the admittedly extremely-unlikely case that these introduce some bug, I'd prefer to merge this in Havana."}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2013-03-18 06:11:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Rename Grenade's DEST to STACK_ROOT

This is to avoid confusion with DevStack's DEST which is set to
${STACK_ROOT}/$BASE_RELEASE in Grenade.

Change-Id: Ibc9b94bd51e7d5dd82ec45f23557923d2f38db96

I'm concerned that this effectively marks a portion of the cell as spare, yet capacity values for those hosts are still included in the updates to the parent cell(s).

I am curious if we could tag the compute host with a 'spare' status to indicate that it is enabled, but not available for 'filtered' scheduling and shouldn't be included in free capacity calculations sent to parent cell(s)."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-03-14 21:56:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This sounds more like a feature then a bug.  And as we are in feature freeze I would prefer to wait for Havana."}, {'account_id': 4419, 'date': '2013-03-15 01:09:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 inline comment)

I think this migration needs a sqlite version?"}, {'account_id': 4419, 'date': '2013-03-21 07:43:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

Hi  Michael,

Thanks for your review.

I don't think setting the sql explicitly is necessary as the sqlalchemy is generating the correct sql as shown in the inline comment.

Please let me know if I'm missing anything though."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-03-21 08:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I guess there are issues with constraints, and dropping and renaming, but you can add:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8442147/how-to-delete-or-add-column-in-sqlite
http://www.sqlite.org/lang_altertable.html'}, {'account_id': 4419, 'date': '2013-03-21 09:01:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

I think sqlite does not support deleting a column directly,
but that sqlalchemy does a pretty good job, by generating sql to rename+drop+refill the table.

I contend that the explicit sql is not needed, as long as the constraint is removed before sqlalchemy removes the column. (line 44 of 162_add_compute_node_spare_flag.py)'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2013-03-21 09:26:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Given your clarification, this looks good.

Thanks guys.

New plan:

 * Gonna start over
 * instead of is_spare field in DB, will use host-aggreagate metadata key 'is_spare'
 * Will use a normal scheduler host filter (sorry belliot for speed loss) - it seems like the right way to do it.
 * This way, an api extension is not needed, but it can all be done in the nova client:
   1. disable compute-service
   2. add host to 'spares' aggregate, (create and set 'is_spare' metadata if not already there)
   3. make sure host has no vms on it, and no migrations going towards it, if it does, reverse steps 1 and 2 and notify user

Will redo fully in the client, making use of service disable, and host aggregates.

To set spare:
 + Disable compute service
   + Check for VMs on it or migrations heading towards it
   + If one is found, re-enable and error out to user
 + Move to the 'spares' host aggregate

To list spares:
 + List spares aggregate

To unspare:
 + Move out of aggregate
 + Enable"}]

commit_message:
Spare compute hosts shouldn't have VMs on them

In order to accomodate for chassis swaps and/or emergency migrations,
cells and scheduler should allow hosts to be marked as spare, which
stops builds and migrations going to that host.

This patch adds the backend support for that. A future patch will add
api functionality allowing administrators to turn 'spare' status on and off.

 * Adds an 'is_spare' boolean field to the 'compute_node' table.
 * Adds an optional 'include_spares' parameter to the db api method
   compute_host_get_all
 * Changes the scheduler's host filter to start off with non-spare
   hosts, rather than all hosts

The reason it is not done as a scheduler host filter, is that
that area of the code is already suffering in performance.

Helps with: bug #1154790
Works towards bp spare-hosts
Change-Id: I9f26bc8ed616d3a39558939033d052cd3f3f3a55

commit_message:
Add missing tests for db.instance_type_* methods

There was no tests in test_db_api for instance_type_* methods.

Add tests to ensure that all works.
Also these tests allow us to refactor work with session and
to add missing unique constraints.

Fix bug in instance_type_get_all, we shouldn't remove
is_public from input filters dictionary.

blueprint db-api-tests

Change-Id: Ia02d73e6ffd964d6edb605039eb95e9f90ff0482

[{'created': '2013-03-27 19:20:14.000000000', 'message': "Adds optional hostname to calls involving users

All calls that involve calling a user by name now
also allow for the host to be specified optionally.

Similarly, all calls that respond with a user also include
the host, defaulting to '%', MySQL's shorthand for 'anywhere'.

There are also a few fixes to get all real, fake, and tox tests
to work. Those will probably be rebased away if other reviews are
merged first.

Change-Id: I6df821ef2ad7d0602a060c853f0ef9bdc5c11c26

also allow for the host to be specified optionally.

Similarly, all calls that respond with a user also include
the host, defaulting to '%', MySQL's shorthand for 'anywhere'.

There are also a few fixes to get all real, fake, and tox tests

commit_message:
Adds optional hostname to calls involving users

All calls that involve calling a user by name now
also allow for the host to be specified optionally.

Similarly, all calls that respond with a user also include
the host, defaulting to '%', MySQL's shorthand for 'anywhere'.

There are also a few fixes to get all real, fake, and tox tests
to work. Those will probably be rebased away if other reviews are
merged first.

Change-Id: I6df821ef2ad7d0602a060c853f0ef9bdc5c11c26

commit_message:
Enhancement to extend Nova HostController update

There seems to be a design flaw in the update method where it raises an
exception if the maintenance mode and status attributes aren't specified,
which makes it impossible to have an API extension that allows the caller
to update additional attributes. None of the other OS API's handle update
this way. It seems alright to check to make sure no extra attributes are
specified (since the extension can remove the ones it handles),
but these 3 lines need to be removed/commented out, so that no exception
thrown when there is a new extension for the Nova HostController.

----------------------------------------
if status is None and maint_mode is None:
    explanation = _("'status' or 'maintenance_mode' needed for host update")
    raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest(explanation=explanation)

Fixes Bug: 1141750

Change-Id: Ibb4d45e361392743f7684dfcb92379fdb037960f

commit_message:
Add glance register image from http service test case

The new test case have swift to serve a file for downloading without
authentication.

The glance service/client extended with the copy_from attribute.

The rest_client will not argue about content-type issues
when the http response status is 200 or any other non error status.

Change-Id: I2bed0d39f408290b3824a3a3b8afcdd3910ee63b

commit_message:
Bring back colorizer again with error results.

This was actually a pretty simple fix. When I switched the base
test result class to testtools I lost the methods that were
printing out the errors at the end. This adds the (colorized!)
methods so errors print successfully.

fixes bug 1159116

Change-Id: Ib09d7e18ddf27015ff735a30137421d865382359

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-27 13:59:18.000000000', 'message': 'Always store old instance_type during a migration

Previously, we were trying to optimize for the migration (as opposed
to resize) case by not storing the old_ instance_type. However,
this is confusing to the vast amount of shared code that works on
migrations and resizes because the "is old == new" logic must be
replicated everywhere. To cut our losses and hopefully avoid other
hidden dragons, this patch removes the optimization and makes both
paths the same.

Fixes bug #1160489

Change-Id: I2ad7b02239baada5fd2174f5b61cdc90ec91e6f5
(cherry picked from commit 985d703d2731fe9ec968ef6698bbf39743ede32a)
'}]
commit_message:
Always store old instance_type during a migration

Previously, we were trying to optimize for the migration (as opposed
to resize) case by not storing the old_ instance_type. However,
this is confusing to the vast amount of shared code that works on
migrations and resizes because the "is old == new" logic must be
replicated everywhere. To cut our losses and hopefully avoid other
hidden dragons, this patch removes the optimization and makes both
paths the same.

Fixes bug #1160489

Change-Id: I2ad7b02239baada5fd2174f5b61cdc90ec91e6f5
(cherry picked from commit 985d703d2731fe9ec968ef6698bbf39743ede32a)

commit_message:
Mark sql_connection with secret flag

sql_connection contains the password in some setups and marking as
secret prevents accidental logging

fixes bug 1160680

Change-Id: Ib2d00219ea40a010c62e6a29045309f030e6de28

[{'created': '2013-03-08 21:45:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add a simple extension hook

This enables stand-alone modules to hook in to the command-line
handler without polluting the existing API namespaces.  These
extensions have access to the existing clients via the client
manager but no way to add another client to the manager is provided..

Change-Id: I4b2eaa780d8ba881db23d950d09b8702e9e314ef
'}, {'created': '2013-03-15 20:23:09.000000000', 'message': 'Add a simple extension hook

This enables stand-alone modules to hook in to the command-line
handler in a dedicated API namespace.  These extensions have access
to the existing clients via the client manager but no way to add
another client to the manager is provided..

blueprint client-extensions

Change-Id: I4b2eaa780d8ba881db23d950d09b8702e9e314ef
'}]
commit_message:
Add a simple extension hook

This enables stand-alone modules to hook in to the command-line
handler in a dedicated API namespace.  These extensions have access
to the existing clients via the client manager but no way to add
another client to the manager is provided..

blueprint client-extensions

Change-Id: I4b2eaa780d8ba881db23d950d09b8702e9e314ef

commit_message:
Added doc support to OS-Flavors Extensions

Adds doc support to os-flavor-access and os-flavor-extra-specs
Samples were curated.
Fixes: bug 1073762
Also fixes: bug 1109175

Change-Id: Ia26467ed45c0368d770c25a1f2c85665986d38c2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-19 21:25:04.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure repeated member deletion fails with 404

Fixes bug 1157427

If an image membership is deleted more than once, the second and
subsequent deletions would be expected to return a 404 Not Found
response code, as opposed to 204 No Content.

Previously, the can_show_deleted logic got in the way, such that
for an admin caller the previously deleted membership was considered
still extant.

We now override the show_deleted logic for deletion, as it makes no
sense to consider the existence of previously deleted database rows
when another deletion request is issued.

Note that there is no corresponding proposal to master as this logic
has been refactored and this no longer affects master.

Change-Id: If8200bbb74e46c814c9f8fa6b4c636e7b022ab6c
'}, {'created': '2013-03-19 23:25:51.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure repeated member deletion fails with 404

commit_message:
Ensure repeated member deletion fails with 404

Fixes bug 1157427

If an image membership is deleted more than once, the second and
subsequent deletions would be expected to return a 404 Not Found
response code, as opposed to 204 No Content.

Previously, the can_show_deleted logic got in the way, such that
for an admin caller the previously deleted membership was considered
still extant.

We now override the show_deleted logic for deletion, as it makes no
sense to consider the existence of previously deleted database rows
when another deletion request is issued.

Note that there is no corresponding proposal to master as this logic
has been refactored and this no longer affects master.

Change-Id: If8200bbb74e46c814c9f8fa6b4c636e7b022ab6c

[{'created': '2013-03-26 08:57:11.000000000', 'message': "Check if creds are present and not None

Currently, KeystoneStrategy checks whether the required credentials are
present in the creds dict but it doesn't check whether they are valid or
not.

This patch checks whether the required creds are present and not None
otherwise a MissingCredentials exception will be raised.

Note: No need for checking parameters' values types since they'll be
instances of basestring once set otherwise they'll be None.

Fixes bug 1157765

Change-Id: I664a604c3cbf2fca60a88c4d887cd9a4b678c8a5
"}]
commit_message:
Check if creds are present and not None

Currently, KeystoneStrategy checks whether the required credentials are
present in the creds dict but it doesn't check whether they are valid or
not.

This patch checks whether the required creds are present and not None
otherwise a MissingCredentials exception will be raised.

Note: No need for checking parameters' values types since they'll be
instances of basestring once set otherwise they'll be None.

Fixes bug 1157765

Change-Id: I664a604c3cbf2fca60a88c4d887cd9a4b678c8a5

'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2013-03-22 20:41:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure I understand why the trivial functions at the top are useful.  In my view, reading a script with 'rm-rf' replaced by '_remove' is obscuring not clarifying.  This doesn't seem to be a situation where you are going to be abstracting different operating system syntax."}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-03-25 09:34:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Dean: The _remove and their friends are extracted, so that they could be mocked out in the tests (see the mocks on the top of test_functions.sh). I tried to apply a test-driven approach during this refactor, and that was the best I could come up with.'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-03-25 12:24:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I agree with Dean - this isn't clear.  Mocking in bash is fun!

I'd suggest prefixing everything you need to mock with a function call to _mockable, defined as:

_mockable () 
{ 
    __mock_cmd=_mock_${1};
    echo $__mock_cmd;
    if [ -n "`declare -f -F $__mock_cmd`" ]; then
        shift;
        $__mock_cmd "$@";
    else
        "$@";
    fi
}

Then you can define a _mock_rm function in your unit test which will be called in place of rm.

Perhaps something at the start of the script to assert that there are no functions mocked out would also be good - just grepping declare -f -F for "_mock_" to make sure that there isn't anything hanging around in the environment when the script is run proper.'}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-03-25 14:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-03-25 15:07:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
enable xml tests test_disk_config

This enable the xml tests in file test_disk_config.
In diskconfig extension, it require disk_config
must be 'AUTO' or 'MANUAL'. So Change it in
test_create_server.py. It can work before, because
it didn't deal with the parameter disk_config.

Partially implements bp missing-tempest-tests

Change-Id: Ib6ed2f2b4319193ba57a139083e8974deeee3f35

Sean: This is a WIP (just testing out an idea).'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2013-03-27 12:12:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Unfortunately this will break a 21->22 upgrade on Fedora where the version of PostgreSQL installed:

  $ rpm -qa | grep postgresql-server
  postgresql-server-9.2.3-1.fc18.x86_64

uses the unique constraint naming convention that I encoded in the initial version of this migration (as I tested against postgres on F18 as opposed to RHEL).

I'll need to come with another way of inferring the original unique constraint name.

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2013-03-27 12:48:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

Fixes LP Bug #1160114.

Change-Id: Iecfaaff86e432af961d2a562ff41cf000aff4595
'}]
commit_message:
Rename image_members_image_id_key in 022.

Updates a unique key contrain in migration 022 so that it
passes on PostgreSQL 8.4 (what is installed on RHEL).

Fixes LP Bug #1160114.

Change-Id: Iecfaaff86e432af961d2a562ff41cf000aff4595

commit_message:
Xml Support for Image Test scripts

Added/Modified required support functions in images_client.py
XML interface script.Added required logic to below scripts
inorder to support both JSON and XML interfaces
* tests/compute/images/test_image_metadata.py
* tests/compute/images/test_list_image_filters.py
* tests/compute/images/test_list_images.py
* tests/compute/test_authorization.py

Change-Id: Ibcce0d81024b46c1b031bc348ca8e8d62e005d8d
Implements: blueprint add-xml-support

commit_message:
Create and delete flavor as regular user

The new negative test cases are trying to perform compute admin
 operations as regular user.
Regular user should not be able to create or delete flavor.

Change-Id: Icec59ba9e39b8a9c9ea93e5e633989c962f42e33

commit_message:
Use common data dir

Paths get stuffed in the database so rather than rewrite them
just leave the data in-place for both versions.  This is how
real upgrades are likely to be done anyway...

Change-Id: I3610d93227b54d4c2f5c832478e7d23afe1bd173

commit_message:
Pin distribute to >=0.6.28

Recently we added flake8 and its requirement for setuptools is 0.6.28
https://readthedocs.org/builds/flake8/460930/

Fixed minimum distribute version to 0.6.28

[{'created': '2013-03-26 15:09:50.000000000', 'message': 'Pass project id in quantum driver secgroup list

The quantum driver is always returning security groups from every tenant
a user has access to, even when the "project" filter is supplied.

Make sure we pass along the project value when we call
quantum.list_security_groups() so it's properly filtered.

Fixes bug 1155381.

Change-Id: I682c66a1f3f9db18b5f9924a37b45c759ff259f7
(cherry picked from commit 775e3b02b2afbf101db22b87a1c3b189d68532e1)
'}]
commit_message:
Pass project id in quantum driver secgroup list

The quantum driver is always returning security groups from every tenant
a user has access to, even when the "project" filter is supplied.

Make sure we pass along the project value when we call
quantum.list_security_groups() so it's properly filtered.

Fixes bug 1155381.

Change-Id: I682c66a1f3f9db18b5f9924a37b45c759ff259f7
(cherry picked from commit 775e3b02b2afbf101db22b87a1c3b189d68532e1)

[{'created': '2013-03-27 10:04:02.000000000', 'message': "Reset ec2 image cache between S3 tests.

We recently introduced EC2 image caching in 2865a76.

On some python 2.6 distros I'm now seeing nova.tests.image.test_s3
failures caused by test ordering issues. Tests appear to reuse
IDs and this can cause issue if we don't clear the cache in tearDown.

Fixes LP Bug #1158935.

Change-Id: Ifeedaf7a784b787de95d2f36394216cf7c94c5f4
(cherry picked from commit 12f7d6332a731421d6e2a190ac60828c1cf98910)
"}, {'created': '2013-03-27 10:07:45.000000000', 'message': "Reset ec2 image cache between S3 tests.

We recently introduced EC2 image caching in f87fa629.

On some python 2.6 distros I'm now seeing nova.tests.image.test_s3
failures caused by test ordering issues. Tests appear to reuse
IDs and this can cause issue if we don't clear the cache in tearDown.

Fixes LP Bug #1158935.

Change-Id: Ifeedaf7a784b787de95d2f36394216cf7c94c5f4
(cherry picked from commit 12f7d6332a731421d6e2a190ac60828c1cf98910)
"}]
commit_message:
Reset ec2 image cache between S3 tests.

We recently introduced EC2 image caching in f87fa629.

On some python 2.6 distros I'm now seeing nova.tests.image.test_s3
failures caused by test ordering issues. Tests appear to reuse
IDs and this can cause issue if we don't clear the cache in tearDown.

Fixes LP Bug #1158935.

Change-Id: Ifeedaf7a784b787de95d2f36394216cf7c94c5f4
(cherry picked from commit 12f7d6332a731421d6e2a190ac60828c1cf98910)

Previously, we were trying to optimize for the migration (as opposed
to resize) case by not storing the old_ instance_type. However,
this is confusing to the vast amount of shared code that works on
migrations and resizes because the "is old == new" logic must be

commit_message:
Always store old instance_type during a migration

Previously, we were trying to optimize for the migration (as opposed
to resize) case by not storing the old_ instance_type. However,
this is confusing to the vast amount of shared code that works on
migrations and resizes because the "is old == new" logic must be
replicated everywhere. To cut our losses and hopefully avoid other
hidden dragons, this patch removes the optimization and makes both
paths the same.

Fixes bug #1160489

Change-Id: I2ad7b02239baada5fd2174f5b61cdc90ec91e6f5

commit_message:
Standardize on newer except syntax

We currently have a mix of 'except X, y:' and 'except X as y:' syntax.
Standardize on the newer 'except as' form.

This patch was generated automatically using:

find * -type f -name 'glance-*' ! -name '*\.conf' ! -name '*\.ini' -o \
 -name '*\.py' | xargs 2to3 -f except | patch -p0

Addresses bug 1160331.

Change-Id: Ica8d1303973af64d0406457267ee75f608e869d0

commit_message:
Adds Tilera back-end for baremetal

blueprint add-tilera-to-baremetal.

The baremetal driver is a hypervisor driver for Openstack Nova
Compute. Within the Openstack framework, it has the same role
as the drivers for other hypervisors (libvirt, xen, etc). With
this patch set of tilera-backend, provisioning and management
of non-PXE tilera physical hardware is accomplished using
common cloud APIs and tools.

Change-Id: I356c06a07ace463779e3b84836d5000331e24814
Co-authored-by: Mikyung Kang <mkkang@isi.edu>
Co-authored-by: David Kang <dkang@isi.edu>
Co-authored-by: Ken Igarashi <igarashik@nttdocomo.co.jp>
Co-authored-by: Arata Notsu <notsu@virtualtech.jp>
Co-authored-by: Devananda van der Veen <devananda.vdv@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix bugs in bulk and slo and small doc change.

Added 411 responses in bulk and slo when needed.

Make X-Static-Large-Object an illegal header with slo installed- somehow
that got lost with some refactor I did.

Change-Id: I986c1656658f874172860469624118cc63bff9bc
(cherry picked from commit 92e877ae51d3bbcb21278426e07eefe703c6ad30)

[{'created': '2013-03-27 06:51:40.000000000', 'message': 'Update --remote-group-id metavar to REMOTE_GROUP

The metavar value for --remote-group-id was left out in the patch
that renamed source_(group_id|ip_prefix) to remote. This patch
renames this instance of SOURCE to REMOTE.

Change-Id: I99d538e1cdc0b29e62b499c9c8ba8b3a31d77f7a
'}]
commit_message:
Update --remote-group-id metavar to REMOTE_GROUP

The metavar value for --remote-group-id was left out in the patch
that renamed source_(group_id|ip_prefix) to remote. This patch
renames this instance of SOURCE to REMOTE.

Change-Id: I99d538e1cdc0b29e62b499c9c8ba8b3a31d77f7a

commit_message:
instruction command was not documented in right format.

Instructions for a Multiple Server Swift Installation (Ubuntu) doc
for creating /var/run/swift and changing owner command were not
using the right format. Missing two colons.

Change-Id: Ie23007a0da498373fbfb137c7edb3d80813c6ba5
Fixes: bug #1158310
(cherry picked from commit c1dfe891e76b2b8ebb99efb71cf61aa81110348e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-27 06:02:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for attempted COPY of objects gt MAX_FILE_SIZE

If X-Copy-From is a manifest object, it can be bigger than MAX_FILE_SIZE.
Currently this fails with 503. It should be 413.

Bug #1158279

Change-Id: I7ec16088046c84e42d5be9c865e1338eb07845b6
(cherry picked from commit 7df43237451a50d8eade94024cd97c50621ed38a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for attempted COPY of objects gt MAX_FILE_SIZE

If X-Copy-From is a manifest object, it can be bigger than MAX_FILE_SIZE.
Currently this fails with 503. It should be 413.

Bug #1158279

Change-Id: I7ec16088046c84e42d5be9c865e1338eb07845b6
(cherry picked from commit 7df43237451a50d8eade94024cd97c50621ed38a)

commit_message:
Use role in insensitive case in keystoneauth.

Using insensitive case could tolerate human error. For example,
user maybe set like this "operator_roles = Admin, swiftoperator"

- also fix a mistake in test, ['admin'] is correct value for roles, not
  'admin' (it will be looped as ['a', 'd', 'm', 'i', 'n'])
- add test for insensitive cases

Fixes: bug #1013120
Change-Id: I56d71da8bc503e48e92dd743692ba6fc237f029e
(cherry picked from commit 7dd966192a43f9937c3e9ac576708447634cdc00)

commit_message:
Improved container-sync resiliency

container-sync now skips faulty objects in the first and second rounds.
All replicas try in the second round.
No server will give up until the faulty object suceeds

Fixes: bug #1068423

Change-Id: I0defc174b2ce3796a6acf410a2d2eae138e8193d
(cherry picked from commit 8b140033f01333fbd6d41e2946db949ab6f92599)

subject: Move eventlet calls to a module.
messages:
[{'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-03-27 03:55:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

(6 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2013-03-27 04:01:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm conflicted with this patch.

On the one hand, I really want to ditch eventlet and I like that this brings us one (small) step closer to doing that.

On the other hand, I really dislike side-effects from importing modules.

In addition to mikal's comments (that I was also making while reviewing, but he published half way through my review, damn you! :) it looks like you're monkey patching multiple times, both in the executable script and when importing in various modules. I'm not sure how well eventlet handles this, but it's probably another argument for not having side effects during import."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-27 04:07:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/25488/1/check/gate-nova-pep8/23657 : FAILURE

- gate-nova-pylint : SKIPPED (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-03-27 04:11:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Johannes -- this is just a quick proof of concept, which is why its rough. The basic problem we're trying to solve is summarized by this IRC paste:

14:51 < notmyname> mordred: just picking up on what seems to be part of an ongoing discussion...what problem 
                   are you trying to solve with having an "eventlet loader" module?
14:51 < mikal> notmyname: if you have dnspython in your env, eventlet monkeypatches getaddrinfo() with a 
               greendns call which isn't ipv6 aware
14:51 < mikal> notmyname: which we discovered when I needed to use dnspython
14:52 < mikal> notmyname: you can turn off the monkey patch, but it involves setting an env var before 
               eventlet is loaded
14:52 < mikal> notmyname: hence a loader'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2013-03-27 04:29:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-27 04:32:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Move eventlet calls to a module.

Additionally, throw if the module isn't the first thing that imports
eventlet. This is required because of monkeypatching of getaddrinfo()
that occurs unless an environment variable is set before eventlet is
imported.

Co-authored-by: Michael Still <mikal@stillhq.com>

Change-Id: I93089aa102adec059ae9eac84b6790a1e8a8e920

[{'created': '2013-03-22 21:33:04.000000000', 'message': "Fix bug with 3PAR host entry in wrong domain

This patch exposes a more acurate exception message
when a user has created a manual host entry on a
3PAR system that is in an incorrect 3PAR domain than
the domain that is configured for the 3PAR driver.

The bug complained that it couldn't find a VLUN, when the
actual problem was the host existed in the wrong 3PAR domain.

Fixes bug #1158991

Change-Id: I3f92e59ae43a10a0788d97d987785b6520f9f1be
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bug with 3PAR host entry in wrong domain

This patch exposes a more acurate exception message
when a user has created a manual host entry on a
3PAR system that is in an incorrect 3PAR domain than
the domain that is configured for the 3PAR driver.

The bug complained that it couldn't find a VLUN, when the
actual problem was the host existed in the wrong 3PAR domain.

Fixes bug #1158991

Change-Id: I3f92e59ae43a10a0788d97d987785b6520f9f1be

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-27 04:35:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix quota updating when admin deletes common user's volume

Add 'project_id=None' optional argument in QUOTAS related methods.

There are two problems when admin deletes volumes of common user
before fixing this bug:
Firstly, It will get tenant quotas using context.project_id which
results in getting admin's quotas not common user's.
Secondly, It will also get wrong quota usages using context.project_id
when updating common user's quota_usages.

So we could pass into QUOTAS related methods an optional argument to
specify the tenant ID to be affected. And if it's not set, then we
default to drawing the tenant ID from the context.

Fixes: bug 1078668
Change-Id: Ie250da84726d1c5c3280430038184000dfd1e9e2
(cherry picked from commit 576c9b0880c32bfc8053550b8f25a76df98c60e4)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix quota updating when admin deletes common user's volume

Add 'project_id=None' optional argument in QUOTAS related methods.

There are two problems when admin deletes volumes of common user
before fixing this bug:
Firstly, It will get tenant quotas using context.project_id which
results in getting admin's quotas not common user's.
Secondly, It will also get wrong quota usages using context.project_id
when updating common user's quota_usages.

So we could pass into QUOTAS related methods an optional argument to
specify the tenant ID to be affected. And if it's not set, then we
default to drawing the tenant ID from the context.

Fixes: bug 1078668
Change-Id: Ie250da84726d1c5c3280430038184000dfd1e9e2
(cherry picked from commit 576c9b0880c32bfc8053550b8f25a76df98c60e4)

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary DB call to find EC2 AZs.

Update get_availability_zone_by_host, so it doesn't need a list of services,
and remove unneeded service_get_all_by_host calls. This removes N DB calls in
the EC2 api when doing a DescribeInstances, where N is number if instances
that are being described.

Partially fix bug 1157437

Change-Id: I0050ba736828faad94549bc6e55f4ca1d05dcbe7
(cherry picked from commit 7ab98e935a63454d0736e6f8a7525a8e73cf6c04)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-26 23:29:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fix /servers/<instance-id>os-security-groups using quantum

When using quantum security groups:
	GET /servers/<instance-id>/os-security-groups
aways returns an empty list. This patch adds a call to
get_instance_security_groups in the api implemenation of security groups.
This method passes both the instance_id and instance_uuid so the api layer
does not need to be aware of which underlying implementation is being used.
The instance_id is needed when using nova and when using quantum the
instance_uuid is needed so both need to be passed.

Fixes bug 1159793

Change-Id: I372adcf93c55d4e6469ef08429ec260d3387f9fe
(cherry picked from commit 3492a7bfc54cb9d581d8a119a08448c01039e80c)

aways returns an empty list. This patch adds a call to
get_instance_security_groups in the api implemenation of security groups.
This method passes both the instance_id and instance_uuid so the api layer
does not need to be aware of which underlying implementation is being used.
The instance_id is needed when using nova and when using quantum the
instance_uuid is needed so both need to be passed.

Fixes bug 1159793

Change-Id: I372adcf93c55d4e6469ef08429ec260d3387f9fe

commit_message:
Fix /servers/<instance-id>os-security-groups using quantum

When using quantum security groups:
	GET /servers/<instance-id>/os-security-groups
aways returns an empty list. This patch adds a call to
get_instance_security_groups in the api implemenation of security groups.
This method passes both the instance_id and instance_uuid so the api layer
does not need to be aware of which underlying implementation is being used.
The instance_id is needed when using nova and when using quantum the
instance_uuid is needed so both need to be passed.

Fixes bug 1159793

Change-Id: I372adcf93c55d4e6469ef08429ec260d3387f9fe

commit_message:
Reformat openstack-common.conf

Use the new 'module' option in openstack-common.conf which is a
multi-string option, allowing each module name to be placed on a
separate line.

This makes it much easier to review changes to the modules list.

Change-Id: I218601a3720287071f05b9f2f624c1de4442d34f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-11 08:41:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix quota updating when admin deletes common user's volume

Add 'project_id=None' optional argument in QUOTAS related methods.

There are two problems when admin deletes volumes of common user
before fixing this bug:
Firstly, It will get tenant quotas using context.project_id which
results in getting admin's quotas not common user's.
Secondly, It will also get wrong quota usages using context.project_id
when updating common user's quota_usages.

So we could pass into QUOTAS related methods an optional argument to
specify the tenant ID to be affected. And if it's not set, then we
default to drawing the tenant ID from the context.

Fixes: bug 1078668
Change-ID: Ie250da84726d1c5c3280430038184000dfd1e9e2
"}, {'created': '2013-03-24 03:37:53.000000000', 'message': "Fix quota updating when admin deletes common user's volume

"}, {'created': '2013-03-24 03:53:40.000000000', 'message': "Fix quota updating when admin deletes common user's volume

commit_message:
Fix quota updating when admin deletes common user's volume

Add 'project_id=None' optional argument in QUOTAS related methods.

There are two problems when admin deletes volumes of common user
before fixing this bug:
Firstly, It will get tenant quotas using context.project_id which
results in getting admin's quotas not common user's.
Secondly, It will also get wrong quota usages using context.project_id
when updating common user's quota_usages.

So we could pass into QUOTAS related methods an optional argument to
specify the tenant ID to be affected. And if it's not set, then we
default to drawing the tenant ID from the context.

Fixes: bug 1078668
Change-Id: Ie250da84726d1c5c3280430038184000dfd1e9e2

commit_message:
Use the same style checking everywhere

Both the run_tests.sh and tox.ini using the same check_source.sh for
style and basic lint testing.

Adding a pyflakes based unused import test.

Removing 2 unused imports from
tempest/tests/network/test_network_basic_ops.py.

Change-Id: I5b4c8b945495751ac68fc64ed5ebf1cf441a5a31

commit_message:
Add the volume and snapshot gigabytes together.

The quota sync functions were not working correctly for both
snapshots and volumes regarding gigabytes. Each would report
their own count as the total gigabytes.

Now the gigabytes sync is separate from the volume and snapshot
count syncs.

Fixes bug #1160004

Change-Id: Ib1200813acb6055412b3f7f6b63fa9ba2b8fa3be
(cherry picked from commit 1fde5a4fbc73a31453f0fe288a0b4a929d7f3026)

commit_message:
Fix adding security groups to an existing instance

Commit 4c34f5f1e8c66e4a865cf7996b283509feb91b71 introduced a
regression making it impossible to add a security group to
an existing instance.

In the javascript membership module, make sure new members are still
assigned the default role even if the role dropdown is not displayed
(as is the case for the instance security group add/remove view).

Fixes bug 1158037.

Change-Id: I986f7296e97a08d5e9141fe0739d4e028e066fc1

[{'created': '2013-03-25 21:34:25.000000000', 'message': 'fix /servers/<instance-id>os-security-groups using quantum

When using quantum security groups:
	GET /servers/<instance-id>/os-security-groups
aways returns an empty list. This patch adds a call to
get_instance_security_groups in the api implemenation of security groups.
This method passes both the instance_id and instance_uuid so the api layer
does not need to be aware of which underlying implementation is being used.
The instance_id is needed when using nova and when using quantum the

Change-Id: I372adcf93c55d4e6469ef08429ec260d3387f9fe

aways returns an empty list. This patch adds a call to

This method passes both the instance_id and instance_uuid so the api layer

Fixes bug 1159793

Change-Id: I372adcf93c55d4e6469ef08429ec260d3387f9fe

commit_message:
Fix /servers/<instance-id>os-security-groups using quantum

When using quantum security groups:
	GET /servers/<instance-id>/os-security-groups
aways returns an empty list. This patch adds a call to
get_instance_security_groups in the api implemenation of security groups.
This method passes both the instance_id and instance_uuid so the api layer
does not need to be aware of which underlying implementation is being used.
The instance_id is needed when using nova and when using quantum the
instance_uuid is needed so both need to be passed.

Fixes bug 1159793

Change-Id: I372adcf93c55d4e6469ef08429ec260d3387f9fe

commit_message:
Fixes Nova API /os-hosts missing element "zone"

Now the HostIndexTemplate of Nova /os-hosts API is missing element "zone",
which will cause the XML output of list hosts missing the zone attribute.

Fixes bug: 1159055

Change-Id: I9940efcfd364c35b00cde4398d531d7ff56dc2b9
(cherry picked from commit c5097ab6682ee1b3021bb628e5083108e3b368d0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-26 21:41:51.000000000', 'message': "translate cinder BadRequest exception

if we attempt to create a volume with values that are invalid (like
a non numeric value for size) we properly get a BadRequest returned
from cinder. However we inproperly pass that cinderclient exception
all the way to the top of the request process, causing a stack trace
to appear in the logs because this is an exception type Nova doesn't
understand.

This situation is triggered by Tempest on every run, and while the
return is successful, the stack trace might spook people.

Fix this by increasing the scope of the existing
_reraise_translated_volume_exception() method. Longer term it would
make sense to have a decorator that handles all possible exceptions
we'd expect from cinder client and turn them into Nova exceptions.

This reduces the number of stack traces in nova-api by 6 on a
successful Tempest run.

Fixes bug #1158505

Step towards blueprint no-stacktraces-in-logs

Change-Id: Ifcfbd5eb11fe9f038f648ca5291499290b7126b1
(cherry picked from commit 3801a4d2f4c59dbfda49131ddde22fcb3976d651)
"}]
commit_message:
translate cinder BadRequest exception

if we attempt to create a volume with values that are invalid (like
a non numeric value for size) we properly get a BadRequest returned
from cinder. However we inproperly pass that cinderclient exception
all the way to the top of the request process, causing a stack trace
to appear in the logs because this is an exception type Nova doesn't
understand.

This situation is triggered by Tempest on every run, and while the
return is successful, the stack trace might spook people.

Fix this by increasing the scope of the existing
_reraise_translated_volume_exception() method. Longer term it would
make sense to have a decorator that handles all possible exceptions
we'd expect from cinder client and turn them into Nova exceptions.

This reduces the number of stack traces in nova-api by 6 on a
successful Tempest run.

Fixes bug #1158505

Step towards blueprint no-stacktraces-in-logs

Change-Id: Ifcfbd5eb11fe9f038f648ca5291499290b7126b1
(cherry picked from commit 3801a4d2f4c59dbfda49131ddde22fcb3976d651)

[{'created': '2013-03-26 14:59:52.000000000', 'message': "Add caching for ec2 mapping ids.

Requests to map ec2 ids can be slow when there are a large number
of instances. These shouldn't ever change so cache them in memory
for a week. The one week timeout is simply to prevent memory from
growing uncontrollably.

Fixes bug 1157437

Change-Id: I3f1c68959a933a7aaa50f122c34a716264c8722d
(cherry picked from commit 76844433f69a7c29ed4566ad34d7e9740feaf660)
"}]
commit_message:
Add caching for ec2 mapping ids.

Requests to map ec2 ids can be slow when there are a large number
of instances. These shouldn't ever change so cache them in memory
for a week. The one week timeout is simply to prevent memory from
growing uncontrollably.

Fixes bug 1157437

Change-Id: I3f1c68959a933a7aaa50f122c34a716264c8722d
(cherry picked from commit 76844433f69a7c29ed4566ad34d7e9740feaf660)

commit_message:
nova-manage vm list fails looking 'instance_type'

The recent set of changes to remove the join on instance_types and get
data from instance_system_metadata missed out the use in
"nova-manage vm list"

fixes bug:  #1158352

Change-Id: I5b06a4fef34331abe40e7429b3abda47070bcbbc
(cherry picked from commit b8f9815c5ab61466009c0447f54abc4c309e4e3f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-26 21:29:07.000000000', 'message': "Don't log traceback on rpc timeout.

Don't log a traceback in the rpc layer after a timeout() occurs while
waiting on a response to a call().  Let the caller get the exception and
decide whether it should be logged or not.

Fix bug 1158920.

Change-Id: I0387ab48899627cbc3eb1d7187067472ddefc1bf
(cherry picked from commit 132a0c1fd1eb127e393e5794ffa6d4a3a4950567)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't log traceback on rpc timeout.

Don't log a traceback in the rpc layer after a timeout() occurs while
waiting on a response to a call().  Let the caller get the exception and
decide whether it should be logged or not.

Fix bug 1158920.

Change-Id: I0387ab48899627cbc3eb1d7187067472ddefc1bf
(cherry picked from commit 132a0c1fd1eb127e393e5794ffa6d4a3a4950567)

commit_message:
set up FakeLogger for root logger.

A recent change in openstack.common.log was made such that it
initialized the root logger instead of the project specific logger,
'nova' in this case.  Update the unit tests for this to fix the problem
where unit tests spam the console with log output.

Fix bug 1159978.

Change-Id: Id64a5b078b4024c3269086ed5d64940b3a38ddfa

vif_type is a new param in legacy_nw_info added in grizzly, and when upgrading
from folsom to grizzly, the existing instance's network info cache in the db doesn't
contain this param, which is needed by vif driver to plug vif to instance. Nova

(cherry picked from commit 45e65d8c0301da689de1afcbc9f45756e71097ab)
"}]
commit_message:
Update instance network info cache to include vif_type.

vif_type is a new param in legacy_nw_info added in grizzly, and when upgrading
from folsom to grizzly, the existing instance's network info cache in the db doesn't
contain this param, which is needed by vif driver to plug vif to instance. Nova
compute will try to plug the vif when it starts the instance, so we need to update
the existing instance's network info cache before pluging instance's VIF.

fix bug #1152426

Change-Id: I1b839bf791b402b933354d9c17c5713fde21ab09
(cherry picked from commit 45e65d8c0301da689de1afcbc9f45756e71097ab)

[{'created': '2013-03-25 23:36:12.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure the NOVA_INSTANCES_PATH is created

Under some conditions when NOVA_STATE_PATH is set
the NOVA_INSTANCES_PATH directory under it is removed
but then not correctly recreated if the parent directory
is owned by root instead of the current user running
devstack. This change fixes that problem by creating
the NOVA_INSTANCES_PATH as root, and then chowning it
to the correct user.

Change-Id: I7fb724787b5e915bae9bd058454d2aa38991364e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure the NOVA_INSTANCES_PATH is created

Under some conditions when NOVA_STATE_PATH is set
the NOVA_INSTANCES_PATH directory under it is removed
but then not correctly recreated if the parent directory
is owned by root instead of the current user running
devstack. This change fixes that problem by creating
the NOVA_INSTANCES_PATH as root, and then chowning it
to the correct user.

Change-Id: I7fb724787b5e915bae9bd058454d2aa38991364e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
xenapi: rpmbuild fixes

Fixes bug 1157695

This fix removes the parted dependency from the rpm specification file,
and also gets rid of the assumption, that the build-rpm.sh is executed
at a specific directory.

Change-Id: I1dcf9096a783a88bc09af0f4f4d5541a7e505748

commit_message:
Adds optional host parameter to users.

All calls that involve calling a user by name now
also allow for the host to be specified optionally.

Similarly, all calls that respond with a user also include
the host, defaulting to '%', MySQL's shorthand for 'anywhere'.

Hosts with dots in the name are escaped to avoid a problem
with the way our routing parses URLs.

Change-Id: Idc5d514a7d862a723469ca8b49f1c51ae07f741b

commit_message:
Fix default nova node names in Grizzly

Folsom compute node names are unqualified in the database, Grizzly
qualifies them with the value of dhcp_domain.  In the migration
we'll unset that for now.

Bug 1160072

Change-Id: I176cace9c5319265944c276d5c8eae704e99f671

commit_message:
Remove unused tools/rfc.sh

This has been deprecated in favour of git-review for quite a while now
and was removed from Nova 10 months ago.

Change-Id: Ic4bfa1aee3a4b6a7588be3678ac033a1b13e2b18

commit_message:
Refactor Redstack to support install via devstack's local.sh hook

Right now we have 2 code paths for installation via devstack.
This trims down redstack so that we have only 1 code path (using the
local.sh hook) to install reddwarf via devstack.

Also added support to local.sh for setting the signing dir via
REDDWARF_AUTH_CACHE_DIR.

Fixes bug: 1154170
Fixes bug: 1105503

Change-Id: I12e61af2a6dd5e06cd59e8cd9947025f25d3dee6

commit_message:
Force deletes using tgt to workaround bug 1159948

Tgt has a bug where it can have multiple copies of an initiator
if there has been a reconnect.

See https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1159948

Change-Id: I9a1b6757eb780efbaa1403016e50de7c0e45d720
(cherry picked from commit b84218633ab5417adf94c568eb54243f4074ab11)

commit_message:
keystone commands don't print any version information

keystone-manage --version and keystone-all --version do
not show any version information. using the commons
version mechanism to set the version number

Fixes bug 1158783

Change-Id: Iade685a060cad8d9b3f2b80089d52faade43aba8

commit_message:
style(HACKING): Add notes about whitespace, naming, and wrapping

This patch is all about optimizing our coding style around readibility:

* Developers spend more time reading code than writing it.
* Newcomers have little (or no) context to draw upon when trying to understand the intent of the original author.
* Code is easier to reason about when it is self-documenting.

Change-Id: If7428195aa31104f194cb240faf5c6946d068e8d

commit_message:
keystone commands don't print any version information

keystone-manage --version and keystone-all --version do
not show any version information. using the commons
version mechanism to set the version number

Fixes bug 1158783

Change-Id: Iade685a060cad8d9b3f2b80089d52faade43aba8

commit_message:
purge the _RELEASE_DIR directories on clean.sh

if we don't do this we can't take in bug fixes to the grizzly
repo from upstream.

Change-Id: I9fab880560404ae47f42e546317ae2b1da27be04

commit_message:
Move tempest runtime dependencies to the pip-requires

Tempest is a test tool.

We should consider all runtime dependency as regular dependency and
they should be in the pip-requires.

The dependencies required just for testing tempest itself should be only in the
test-requires.

Fixing bug #1090020

Change-Id: I4107bf79dd4fa6d6902b4d0e6bfc795f1eb5b787

commit_message:
Change the column counter_volume to Float

counter_volume was previously an Integer (32 bits value in SQL
implementations as MySQL or PostgreSQL) and limited in values from
-2147483648 to 2147483647, very small for things like disk I/O bytes,
network I/O bytes, image size, object size, volume size, …
Furthermore one might want to store some real numbers (ℝ) (temperatures,
power comsumption, …)

Change-Id: Ifdb8e8e84e8e01df267d71bc72cdc3f56bb2f695
Fixes: bug #1158276

commit_message:
Refactor of test_network_basic_ops -prep new tests

    This is the preparatory work that enables new tests to be added which
    can re-use code currently in test_network_basic_ops. It pulls out a
    number of methods to a common library.

    Implements: blueprint quantum-quota-basic-tests quota tests
    Change-Id: I57336acd038cb70b6e9d8025b9c9e01d72475768

Change-Id: I6b916d4d15f4af05882a0ff0f384907d5bf3360c

commit_message:
Fixes build of compute admin guide.

Fix bug 1096168, choosing a host to launch instance upon
Fix bug 1098567, project id instead of project name for scrub

Removes replicated XenAPI - NFS file and makes pointers to single file

Change-Id: I80de83afd8a535401098035be05fe734edb328fe

[{'created': '2013-03-13 16:49:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Hyper V instance conflicts

Fixes bug 1152368

If the hyperv driver attempts to boot an instance and a previous
instance with the same name was not properly removed, the boot will
fail due to an error creating root.vhd.  This only happens when
using CoW images.  This fix deletes the instance directory before
creating the new instance so that there will never be an old image
to interfere with creation of the new one.

This is most likely to be an issue in development and test
environments that toggle between versions of nova with no migration
path.

commit_message:
Fix Hyper V instance conflicts

Fixes bug 1152368

If the hyperv driver attempts to boot an instance and a previous
instance with the same name was not properly removed, the boot will
fail due to an error creating root.vhd.  This only happens when
using CoW images.  This fix deletes the instance directory before
creating the new instance so that there will never be an old image
to interfere with creation of the new one.

This is most likely to be an issue in development and test
environments that toggle between versions of nova with no migration
path.

Change-Id: I21eab01590c426234b4b9a55abec4b2d2df0e168

commit_message:
Import latest openstack.common.setup

Import latest openstack.common.setup from oslo-incubator.
Fixes bug 1158319 (Include Co-authored-by entries in AUTHORS), but also:
* stop using --stat for ChangeLog
* failing to get version from git
* returncode for Popen is valid only after communicate call

Change-Id: Ib7a391560ec885b5478208cd441ce2c10e9d8cac

commit_message:
Retry http_request and json_request failure.

Temporary network outages or keystone server restarts can lead
to a connection refused in auth_token middleware. Rather than
failing immediately, this patch attempts to retry a few times.

Fixes bug 1150299

(pulled from python-keystoneclient commit
9bb29b9dff4d220eaabf86cd286e651c5ae15b98)

Change-Id: I2ecf0d7745290976efcb3e3cd6511817a53d3e0a

[{'created': '2013-03-26 10:34:17.000000000', 'message': "Add metadata support for nvp plugin without namespaces

If using a host that does not support namespaces the nvp plugin did not have
a way to leverage metadata unless using enable_isolated_metadata which
requires a subnet to not have a gateway. This patch changes the metadata
configuration for the NVP plugin by adding a flag meatadata_mode which can be
set to access_network (which was previously enable_metadata_access_network)
or dhcp_host_route. When set to dhcp_host_route when the dhcp agent creates
it's port a host_route is added towards the dhcp server's ip for the
destination 169.254.169.254/32 only if the subnet has as gatway_ip.
In order for a host to leverage metadata via dhcp_route_route it requires
the host's dhcp client to support host routes (code 121).

Fixes bug 1155786

Change-Id: I2ff52adc3dfebcdd6d9c05d5dc79aa65ae100c74

to the dhcp server's ip address for 169.254.169.254/32 if the subnet has
as gatway_ip. In order for a host to leverage this it requires the host's
dhcp client to support host routes (code 121).

Fixes bug 1155786

commit_message:
Add metadata support for nvp plugin without namespaces

If using a host that does not support namespaces the nvp plugin did not have
a way to leverage metadata unless using enable_isolated_metadata which
requires a subnet to not have a gateway. This patch changes the metadata
configuration for the NVP plugin by adding a flag metadata which can be
set to access_network (which was previously enable_metadata_access_network)
or dhcp_host_route. When set to dhcp_host_route when the dhcp agent creates
it's port a host_route is added towards the dhcp server's ip for the
destination 169.254.169.254/32 only if the subnet has as gatway_ip.
In order for a host to leverage metadata via dhcp_route_route it requires
the host's dhcp client to support host routes (code 121).

Fixes bug 1155786

Change-Id: I2ff52adc3dfebcdd6d9c05d5dc79aa65ae100c74

subject: Fixed pep8 errors in test directory.
messages:
[{'account_id': 866, 'date': '2013-03-22 15:16:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the PEP8 fixes but for tox.ini changes it was decided that we don't gate on PEP8 for tests. we can change that if others swift core don't mind it."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-03-25 20:11:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I'm happy to require PEP8 for tests.

For Swift, what I don't want is to have another giant pile of Gerrit reviews that each go around touching a particular file to make it PEP8 compliant, or worse, make *part* of a particular file PEP8 compliant. That just leads to a ton of noise in Gerrit. Worse yet, you get people standing around bikeshedding about parens versus backslashes and other trivial crap, and it winds up drowning the useful work in a sea of useless.

Since this commit (a) turns on PEP8 gating for tests, *and* (b) fixes all the PEP8 errors in the tests, I'm more than happy to merge it.*

Just my opinion, though. Don't take it as some sort of consensus. :)

* Note to future readers of this comment: if you're thinking of turning on PEP8 gating for Swift's tests, you should know that reviewers also dislike enormous diffs that touch dozens and dozens of files. Caveat coder."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-03-25 21:12:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-25 21:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

commit_message:
Fixed pep8 errors in test directory.

Files test_swiftclient.py and utils.py had all pep8 errors
fixed.

Also added tests directory to tox.ini file, so that
pep8 would monitor tests directory by default.

Change-Id: Id60a2cd88bd814d1dcbeca951764c9d236500837
Fixes: bug #1158819

commit_message:
Don't include traceback when wrapping exceptions

The fix in fa52cb09b2270876c9d9a03106f961be6c9db834 strips tracebacks
from exceptions when returning them to the user, but it still spams
the log with a long traceback. We shouldn't be including the traceback
when we wrap the exception in the first place. Instead we just
include the message.

It also updates the error code to 409 for device in use since this
is actually a conflict.

Fix for:

  bug 1155315
  bug 1103324
  bug 1092610

Change-Id: I95019a3022eb52e0335c455009c13fe229475d03
(cherry picked from commit d63bd8d692a9eb16caa818101cdbb3358f6b4681)

[{'created': '2013-03-04 23:35:26.000000000', 'message': 'Decouple EC2 API from using instance id

Continuation of 0dc32690fe158e4cb11c2c9bcc65acaf73b94a7a

Some code in ec2 api use Instance.id rather than InstanceIdMapping.id
directly while converting ec2 id to an instance object. This is very
dangerous if Instance.id is not equal to InstanceIdMapping.id for the
same instance uuid.

To avoid the id mapping confusion, this patch:

 * uses instance_id_mappings.id instead of instances.id
 * uses instance_uuid in ec2utils.id_to_ec2_inst_id
 * removes ec2utils.ec2_instance_id_to_uuid

Change-Id: I22638f667c18eefe542b03e31f1a3aa2ce782db7
(cherry picked from commit 79cc2a21b645138f70c6ca4b54053f69c0dde81d)

commit_message:
Decouple EC2 API from using instance id

Continuation of 0dc32690fe158e4cb11c2c9bcc65acaf73b94a7a

Some code in ec2 api use Instance.id rather than InstanceIdMapping.id
directly while converting ec2 id to an instance object. This is very
dangerous if Instance.id is not equal to InstanceIdMapping.id for the
same instance uuid.

To avoid the id mapping confusion, this patch:

 * uses instance_id_mappings.id instead of instances.id
 * uses instance_uuid in ec2utils.id_to_ec2_inst_id
 * removes ec2utils.ec2_instance_id_to_uuid

Fixes bug 1145490

Change-Id: I22638f667c18eefe542b03e31f1a3aa2ce782db7
(cherry picked from commit 79cc2a21b645138f70c6ca4b54053f69c0dde81d)

commit_message:
Fixes PowerVM spawn failed as missing attr supported_instances

During test in a cross-hypervisor environment (KVM+PowerVM), user will run
into an issue during deploying an instance for Power host by PowerVM driver,
though the property "hypervisor_type" for the PowerVM image have been
configured. Since the _update_host_stats of PowerVM driver missing the
attribute "supported_instances".

Fixes bug: 1155498

Change-Id: I81259d153a7b5ae35747e57c53b14e0075d28d78

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-02 22:06:19.000000000', 'message': 'populate dnsmasq lease db with valid leases

At start dnsmasq retrieves its lease db by calling the nova-dhcpbridge
script with the init action.

Previously we were returning all allocated IPs in the network and
calculating the lease exirpation time based upon instances.updated_at
or instances.created_at.

Now we are only returning entries for IPs that are allocated and leased.
Additionally we set the lease expiration time to be i
now + CONF.dhcp_lease_time

Change-Id: Ie3b4fafd38094dc01ceea592ab5229e581193512
Fixes: bug #1103260
(cherry picked from commit e12339def3d9182f5ab23869e6bdc946e8e42825)
'}]
commit_message:
populate dnsmasq lease db with valid leases

At start dnsmasq retrieves its lease db by calling the nova-dhcpbridge
script with the init action.

Previously we were returning all allocated IPs in the network and
calculating the lease exirpation time based upon instances.updated_at
or instances.created_at.

Now we are only returning entries for IPs that are allocated and leased.
Additionally we set the lease expiration time to be i
now + CONF.dhcp_lease_time

Change-Id: Ie3b4fafd38094dc01ceea592ab5229e581193512
Fixes: bug #1103260
(cherry picked from commit e12339def3d9182f5ab23869e6bdc946e8e42825)

commit_message:
Support for ssh auth to VMs via public key

Implements a new configuration parameter to choose the
auth strategy for ssh enabled tests:
- password base (current implementation)
- public key based (new default)
Modifies compute test base class to create a server
resources with keypair pubkey is enabled.
Enables run_ssh flag in tempest.conf.sample.
Updates relevant tests to use the create_server
wrapper method in BaseComputeTest.
Fixes uptime command for cirros image.

Skips ssh on quantum gate until bug #1153280 is fixed.

Implements: blueprint ssh-auth-strategy
Change-Id: Ic8510718523be4a639726bfd7ee2871952781eb4

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-14 15:26:23.000000000', 'message': "Fixes PowerVM spawn fails when network is not set

Spawn assumes there is at least one network interface defines when making
this call in nova.virt.powervm.operator:

mac = network_info[0]['address']

The fix will check for network_info length and default slot id to 5 (which
is in the allowed range in PowerVM) in that scenario.
virtual_eth_mac_base_value should also be defaulted to None in lpar
definition, this will let VIOS generate a mac for the interface.

Fixes bug: 1154175

Change-Id: I8570e867fbf2e57be83b7e830d63ef5c7f266119
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes PowerVM spawn fails when network is not set

Spawn assumes there is at least one network interface defines when making
this call in nova.virt.powervm.operator:

mac = network_info[0]['address']

The fix will check for network_info length and default slot id to 5 (which
is in the allowed range in PowerVM) in that scenario.
virtual_eth_mac_base_value should also be defaulted to None in lpar
definition, this will let VIOS generate a mac for the interface.

Fixes bug: 1154175

Change-Id: I8570e867fbf2e57be83b7e830d63ef5c7f266119

commit_message:
Add VPCZoneIdentifier property in AutoScalingGroup

AWS::AutoScaling::AutoScalingGroup now supports the VPCZoneIdentifier.
The availability zone of the subnet must match the availability zone
specified in the autoscaling group properties.

Fixes bug 1096017

Change-Id: Ib946542660a2973ec1003fb880a48e20b1006350
Signed-off-by: Jeff Peeler <jpeeler@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add support for retrieving instance-actions info

Adds an extension for querying instance-actions info on an instance.
There are two new commands: 'instance-action-list <server>' which lists
actions that have been recorded for that instance, and 'instance-action
<server> <request_id>' which provides more details for the action with
that request_id on that server.

Change-Id: I22492d682d50b78f522f10269221fea9483df6dd

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-25 18:35:20.000000000', 'message': 'Split commands properly for bash completion test.

The bash completion test was trying to loop over some options in order
to test that they appeared in the output.  This splits the list so that
proper looping occurs.  This helps protect against test failures when
new options are added and the bash completion output changes order.

Change-Id: I81517038953fb429e8d98b762c77749bbbc0e8d7
'}]
commit_message:
Split commands properly for bash completion test.

The bash completion test was trying to loop over some options in order
to test that they appeared in the output.  This splits the list so that
proper looping occurs.  This helps protect against test failures when
new options are added and the bash completion output changes order.

Change-Id: I81517038953fb429e8d98b762c77749bbbc0e8d7

commit_message:
Don't check build/ for pep8 violations

There's no need to run pep8 on the build dir, and it contains E502 false
positives due to some part of the build process adding line
continuations in places that they're not needed.

Change-Id: I7ea19aea2b9e46503aa8acc06ce6b9d7ea18113a

Hi Alessandro,

From what I read about the live-migration of libvirt and xen implementation of the checking, the content of the dictionary is hypervisor dependent. For KVM, check_can_live_migration returns a dict contains keys such as filename, block_migration, disck_over_commit, and disk_available_mb. For Xenapi, the same function returns a dict contains keys such as block_migration, another dict called migrated_data. revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-25 15:27:48.000000000', 'message': 'NoneType exception thrown if driver live-migration check returns None

Multiple bugs have been reported for different drivers about a change
in behaviour of the compute manager live-migration checks that now
requires drivers to return a dict instead of just passing None as the
return value. See bug 1129091 (Hyper-V) and bug 1158603 (XenAPI).

Resolves bug 1158603.

Change-Id: I0db364a17e3069b0b7e3f19030afc35283edecfb
'}, {'created': '2013-03-25 20:59:51.000000000', 'message': 'NoneType exception thrown if driver live-migration check returns None

XenAPI driver live-migration checks must return dicts as required by
the virt api interface.

Resolves bug 1158603.

Change-Id: I0db364a17e3069b0b7e3f19030afc35283edecfb
'}]
commit_message:
NoneType exception thrown if driver live-migration check returns None

XenAPI driver live-migration checks must return dicts as required by
the virt api interface.

Resolves bug 1158603.

Change-Id: I0db364a17e3069b0b7e3f19030afc35283edecfb

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-25 07:50:08.000000000', 'message': "gettextutils: fix translation domain

Fixes bug #1076285

When oslo-incubator code gets copied into a project, the project's
l10n infrastructure will extract translatable messages from the
oslo code into the project's message catalog. Translations of those
messages will not be found if we use 'openstack.common' as the
translation domain.

Instead, use 'oslo' as the translation domain and update.py will
change this to the project name.

Change-Id: I7ab46c4f860c9c307758ab63002ae410e4f975fe
"}]
commit_message:
gettextutils: fix translation domain

Fixes bug #1076285

When oslo-incubator code gets copied into a project, the project's
l10n infrastructure will extract translatable messages from the
oslo code into the project's message catalog. Translations of those
messages will not be found if we use 'openstack.common' as the
translation domain.

Instead, use 'oslo' as the translation domain and update.py will
change this to the project name.

Change-Id: I7ab46c4f860c9c307758ab63002ae410e4f975fe

commit_message:
correct the reduplicate tests for list_severs_with_detail({'limit':1})

Currently, the test test_list_servers_detailed_filter_by_limit is the
same as test_list_servers_detailed_limit_results, so change it to test
list_servers not list_servers_with_detail.

Change-Id: I879dfe79b3dcb99b9e1c9f9cc5413cee4349b73a

commit_message:
Make volume attach and detach rescue tests negative.

Previously, test_rescued_vm_detach_volume() and
test_rescued_vm_attach_volume() were being skipped because of a bug.
However, the fix for that bug, which has been committed, was to disable
this functionality. It is now incorrect behavior to attach or detach a
volume for a instance in the rescue state. So, this commit changes the
tests to be negative and checks for the error response.

Change-Id: I80c0d33f078b0df46c2af7ea0df6b141a56dc2a2

commit_message:
In CLI tests set merge_stderr to False by default

Ignore stderr by default, unless merge_stderr=True. ignoring stderr by
default makes the output more deterministic since stderr can contain
random log output (especially in *-manage commands)

Change-Id: I849444b8416e75c0383132ff2f93bd6d92df60f1

commit_message:
validate_template returns whole Parameters snippet

Currently the engine validate_template returns cfn formatted
Parameters from the template, which isn't actually very useful
to build a full UI from a validate call.

This change returns the original Parameters template snippet
and changes the cfn api to reformat to the CFN API legacy format.

The Parameters section of the RPC and the REST APIs now return
a dictionary containing the parameters as specified in the template.
Previously the Parameters section contained a list in the CFN API
format.

Pseudo parameters are filtered out of the validate results.

Change-Id: Iea53dc847ff13f5f479ec3a66bcf141c4ccaeb25
Fixes: bug #1157537

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-01 17:24:31.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: Optimize test_connection and capabilities

The getCapabilities call can be very slow so it is not a good choice
for testing the libvirt connection. This patch switches to
getLibVersion and also caches the result of getCapabilities so it
doesn't need to be requested every time. Note that this means that
nova-compute will need to be restarted if the capaabilities of the
host changes. This is an acceptable risk because capabilities
changes should be very rare and nova-compute should be restarted
if libvirt is restarted or reinstalled.

This simple change lowers boot time in my devstack install from
22 seconds down to 8 seconds!

Fixes bug 1100446
(cherry picked from commit ec3d7e4cb882eff42fa8f1e5f8f52723fb909b0e)

Conflicts:
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

Change-Id: I3adbb48a2859a54ed93503f26de684acbd157841
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Optimize test_connection and capabilities

The getCapabilities call can be very slow so it is not a good choice
for testing the libvirt connection. This patch switches to
getLibVersion and also caches the result of getCapabilities so it
doesn't need to be requested every time. Note that this means that
nova-compute will need to be restarted if the capaabilities of the
host changes. This is an acceptable risk because capabilities
changes should be very rare and nova-compute should be restarted
if libvirt is restarted or reinstalled.

This simple change lowers boot time in my devstack install from
22 seconds down to 8 seconds!

Fixes bug 1100446

commit_message:
Force deletes using tgt to workaround bug 1159948

Tgt has a bug where it can have multiple copies of an initiator
if there has been a reconnect.

See https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1159948

Change-Id: I9a1b6757eb780efbaa1403016e50de7c0e45d720
(cherry picked from commit b84218633ab5417adf94c568eb54243f4074ab11)

get_instance_nw_info() in nova.network.manager should list
InstanceNotFound as a client exception for rpc. This to prevent the
rpc layer from logging a traceback when this exception is raised.
This is an expected type of exception that should be left to the
client to handle.

Resolves bug 1157411.

Change-Id: I6735fb8a386f2256ac8af0ce7fdb36ef7a00b6ce
'}]
commit_message:
List InstanceNotFound as a client exception

get_instance_nw_info() in nova.network.manager should list
InstanceNotFound as a client exception for rpc. This to prevent the
rpc layer from logging a traceback when this exception is raised.
This is an expected type of exception that should be left to the
client to handle.

Resolves bug 1157411.

Change-Id: I6735fb8a386f2256ac8af0ce7fdb36ef7a00b6ce

subject: Ensure DB pooling code works with newer eventlet versions
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-26 01:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/25339/1/check/gate-quantum-pep8/6017 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25339/1/check/gate-quantum-docs/5276 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25339/1/check/gate-quantum-python26/5649 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25339/1/check/gate-quantum-python26-rhel6/60 : FAILURE (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/25339/1/check/gate-quantum-python27/5663 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25339/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/15956 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-26 01:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-26 01:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/25339/1/gate/gate-quantum-docs/5283 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25339/1/gate/gate-quantum-pep8/6024 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25339/1/gate/gate-quantum-python26/5656 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25339/1/gate/gate-quantum-python27/5670 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25339/1/gate/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/15979 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-03-26 01:34:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

I think we agree on the long-term goal here.  Our judgement was that the risk if introducing the OSLO code this late in the game was higher than the risk of not doing so.  If people feel this is the wrong trade-off to make, we can have a discussion around backporting OSLO DB to milestone-proposed or stable-grizzly (whichever it is at that point).  

I don't believe any comments have suggested that this existing patch is wrong, just that it solves a problem with using eventlet for db pooling, while we should in general be moving away from using eventlet for db pooling.  

Given that today is our RC2 deadline, I'm going to approve this change, and we can use the following bug to track actually moving quantum away from eventlet db thread pooling: https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1160124"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-03-26 01:34:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This will not fix all issues with thread pooling for DB calls.  One should use the oslo db/api.py code to enable thread pooling.  We removed the use of eventlet db_pool from nova because you need the *whole transaction* run in the same thread..  while eventlet db_pool code wraps each SQL query individually.  Ie, with eventlet, an 'UPDATE' and a 'COMMIT' for the same transaction can run in different threads in the pool.  This means that you can exhaust all threads for the UPDATEs with no threads available for the COMMIT..."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-03-26 01:34:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's more than a limitation.  It simply will cause failures when enabled.  You'll have queries stuck waiting on SQL locks until they time out and fail.  It's be better to just remove the option than not fixing it."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-03-26 01:34:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Chris Behrens	  We're aware of the limitations of the current approach and that the solution in oslo.db works better for the long term.  We didn't migrate to Oslo's code because the implementations are different enough that we could not ensure stability of the released version in time for the final release.

This change simply allows Quantum to work with newer versions of eventlet and does not address the known limitations."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2013-03-26 01:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-26 01:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

[{'created': '2013-03-26 01:34:54.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure DB pooling code works with newer eventlet versions

Bug 1097992

commit_message:
Remove deprecated Grizzly features

Now that Havana has started, remove deprecated Grizzly features

* deprecated alias list_notifier_drivers (for notification_driver)
* openstack/common/notifier/rabbit_notifier.py (use rpc_notifier
  instead)

Change-Id: I0dbb997ba774f58766bddf950049ec1e2d5b79de

commit_message:
Update to use flake8.

flake8 is pluggable and handles pep8 and pyflakes, as well as configuration
through tox.ini. It also removes the need for flakes.py.

Change-Id: If5f7d8ad348b4fb8119fa4ec7b5e9d17bdc72a39

commit_message:
Add doc support for OS-Services ext v2

Added doc support to os-services extension v2.
The ext allows to manage nova services.
This API has some internal internal inconsistencies that
prevent it from generating xml samples (they should be
available in v3).

Change-Id: I4922daabfbd3454439a07be1c425a52e0fddd821
Fixes: bug 1078015

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-21 19:08:05.000000000', 'message': "Remove unnecessary DB call to find EC2 AZs.

Update get_availability_zone_by_host, so it doesn't need a list of services,
and remove unneeded service_get_all_by_host calls. This removes N DB calls in
the EC2 api when doing a DescribeInstances, where N is number if instances
that are being described.

Partially fix bug 1157437

Change-Id: I0050ba736828faad94549bc6e55f4ca1d05dcbe7
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary DB call to find EC2 AZs.

Update get_availability_zone_by_host, so it doesn't need a list of services,
and remove unneeded service_get_all_by_host calls. This removes N DB calls in
the EC2 api when doing a DescribeInstances, where N is number if instances
that are being described.

Partially fix bug 1157437

Change-Id: I0050ba736828faad94549bc6e55f4ca1d05dcbe7

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-25 20:12:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add the volume and snapshot gigabytes together.

The quota sync functions were not working correctly for both
snapshots and volumes regarding gigabytes. Each would report
their own count as the total gigabytes.

Now the gigabytes sync is separate from the volume and snapshot
count syncs.

Fixes bug #1160004

Change-Id: Ib1200813acb6055412b3f7f6b63fa9ba2b8fa3be
'}]
commit_message:
Add the volume and snapshot gigabytes together.

The quota sync functions were not working correctly for both
snapshots and volumes regarding gigabytes. Each would report
their own count as the total gigabytes.

Now the gigabytes sync is separate from the volume and snapshot
count syncs.

Fixes bug #1160004

Change-Id: Ib1200813acb6055412b3f7f6b63fa9ba2b8fa3be

commit_message:
Add tests for image visibility filter in db

Some aspects of visibility filtering in the db api were not being
tested. This patch adds tests to ensure visibility=public|private is
working properly.

Change-Id: I67a4b8e33fab6f4f8f1ed4b05b2b8cac10153105

commit_message:
Check if creds are present and not None

Currently, KeystoneStrategy checks whether the required credentials are
present in the creds dict but it doesn't check whether they are valid or
not.

This patch checks whether the required creds are present and not None
otherwise a MissingCredentials exception will be raised.

Note: No need for checking parameters' values types since they'll be
instances of basestring once set otherwise they'll be None.

Fixes bug 1157765

Change-Id: I664a604c3cbf2fca60a88c4d887cd9a4b678c8a5
