commit_message:
Force deletes using tgt to workaround bug 1159948

Tgt has a bug where it can have multiple copies of an initiator
if there has been a reconnect.

See https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1159948

Change-Id: I9a1b6757eb780efbaa1403016e50de7c0e45d720

commit_message:
Fix SimpleReadOnlyNovaManageTest.test_flavor_list CLI test

'nova-manage flavor list' should equal 'nova-manage instance_type list'

Adds an option, merge_stderr, that when enabled redirects stderr to
stdout.

Fix bug 1159914

commit_message:
Remove extraneous output during testing

During shell tests commands were being passed to novaclient and output
was being printed to stdout.  This quickly scrolls useful test output
offscreen, so lets suppress it.

Also removed a print call from a test.

Change-Id: I31c8bf2f92a64d781c9e3350213f2e1503b960ad

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-22 01:08:43.000000000', 'message': "Eliminate strange behavior with is_public filter in v2

The v2 API changed from using the 'is_public' field for determining
visibility to using the 'visibility' field.  Also, when getting an image
listing, it changed from having explicit property filters to having
implicit property filters.  In v2 any query string parameter sent to
/v2/images/ that is not a known type is assumed to be a filter.

The way the code works uses one database query implementation for both
protocols.  In that implementation it introspects the models.Image
object to determine.  Any member variables are searched as columns, any
key that is not a member variable name results in a search of the image
properties.

In the conversion in v2 from is_public to visibility the value of
visibility is translated to a db query on the is_public column.
Unfortunately this results in strange value when a user of v2 attempts
to use the is_public filter to search.  They cannot get an error message
telling them to use 'visibility' instead because 'is_public' could very
well be a property.  Thus we must search for is_public as a property in
v2.

This patch eliminates the strange behavior and fixes the bug.  It also
introduces a 'API_version' member to the context object that is threaded
through the service.  This is needed to fix this bug and could also
prove useful in other places that may need to know the API version in
which the request context is happening.

fixes bug: 1157988
fixes bug: 1154760

Change-Id: I85a48dc86f498942b1188219679ee5167a56dee0
"}]
commit_message:
Eliminate strange behavior with is_public filter in v2

The v2 API changed from using the 'is_public' field for determining
visibility to using the 'visibility' field.  Also, when getting an image
listing, it changed from having explicit property filters to having
implicit property filters.  In v2 any query string parameter sent to
/v2/images/ that is not a known type is assumed to be a filter.

The way the code works uses one database query implementation for both
protocols.  In that implementation it introspects the models.Image
object to determine.  Any member variables are searched as columns, any
key that is not a member variable name results in a search of the image
properties.

In the conversion in v2 from is_public to visibility the value of
visibility is translated to a db query on the is_public column.
Unfortunately this results in strange value when a user of v2 attempts
to use the is_public filter to search.  They cannot get an error message
telling them to use 'visibility' instead because 'is_public' could very
well be a property.  Thus we must search for is_public as a property in
v2.

This patch eliminates the strange behavior and fixes the bug.  It also
introduces a 'API_version' member to the context object that is threaded
through the service.  This is needed to fix this bug and could also
prove useful in other places that may need to know the API version in
which the request context is happening.

fixes bug: 1157988
fixes bug: 1154760

Change-Id: I85a48dc86f498942b1188219679ee5167a56dee0

[{'created': '2013-03-25 07:34:26.000000000', 'message': "Reformat openstack-common.conf

Use the new 'module' option in openstack-common.conf which is a
multi-string option, allowing each module name to be placed on a
separate line.

This makes it much easier to review changes to the modules list.

Change-Id: I218601a3720287071f05b9f2f624c1de4442d34f
"}]
commit_message:
Reformat openstack-common.conf

Use the new 'module' option in openstack-common.conf which is a
multi-string option, allowing each module name to be placed on a
separate line.

This makes it much easier to review changes to the modules list.

As far as changing the API is concerned, this falls under the domain of the extensions, and as far as I'm concerned, those are (somewhat) mutable. commit_message:
Remove unnecessary checks in api.py

Remove existing check to ensure instance was running
when adding or removing security groups to/from an
instance.
Modified unit test accordingly
Fixes bug 1107721

Change-Id: If1148653edd96bd70b983c2fa89cd9973d80e48b

paste.ini: auth_host should not be hardcoded

paste.ini: admin variables should use Linux syntax for environment variables (unless this is how Paste Deploy works)

paste.ini: config_file doesn't allow absolute paths (we'll deal with it if it's a Paste Deploy thing)

marconi.conf-sample: port = 8888 isn't appropriate for wsgi.  This is really the http port that uwsgi uses, which belongs in a uwsgi.ini file, not here.

Speaking of which, consider including a sample uwsgi.ini file that specifies plugin = python, the paste path, and the http port.

wsgi.conf shouldn't be in the patch.  It's redundant to marconi.conf-sample, and obsolete."}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-03-20 22:32:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(5 inline comments)

Hey,

I put some comments in line. I would prefer to have more "control" on commands and bootstrap process instead of leaving *everything* to paste. I don't like the idea of having a /lib folder in marconi's root.

Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 6943, 'date': '2013-03-20 23:32:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-03-21 08:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

@Allan:

paste.ini: Variable names are simply in the same form as other OpenStack projects. See: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/etc/nova/api-paste.ini#L99
paste.ini: This seems to be a limitation of either our config module or oslo.config, which we can consider amending in a new story. See: https://github.com/stackforge/marconi/blob/master/marconi/common/config.py#L119

marconi.conf-sample: This port will be used when we add self-hosting to Marconi. At this point a uwsgi.ini might be a little overboard as we aren't requiring users to run uwsgi as their WSGI server. We just happen to be internally :-) What do you think?

I agree with all your other points and changes were made as appropriate."}, {'account_id': 6427, 'date': '2013-03-22 01:44:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-25 14:33:33.000000000', 'message': "Do not test foreign keys with SQLite version < 3.7

Fixes bug 1158828

Even though SQLAlchemy is documented to support foreign keys (with
the pragma set) on SQLite >= 3.6.19, we're seeing consistent problems
with that support on RHEL 6.4 with SQLite 3.6.20.  It works fine on
Fedora and Ubuntu with SQLite 3.7.x.

To work around these problems, if we're using SQLite, test the SQLite
version inside the test that requires foreign key support,
and return early to skip the test if it's < 3.7

Change-Id: I1c26f29371376b271a4e384ea7b5d2009651acc1
"}, {'created': '2013-03-25 14:53:51.000000000', 'message': "Do not test foreign keys with SQLite version < 3.7

Fixes bug 1158828

Even though SQLAlchemy is documented to support foreign keys (with
the pragma set) on SQLite >= 3.6.19, we're seeing consistent problems
with that support on RHEL 6.4 with SQLite 3.6.20.  It works fine on
Fedora and Ubuntu with SQLite 3.7.x.

To work around these problems, if we're using SQLite, test the SQLite
version inside the test that requires foreign key support,
and skip the test if it's < 3.7

Change-Id: I1c26f29371376b271a4e384ea7b5d2009651acc1
"}]
commit_message:
Do not test foreign keys with SQLite version < 3.7

Fixes bug 1158828

Even though SQLAlchemy is documented to support foreign keys (with
the pragma set) on SQLite >= 3.6.19, we're seeing consistent problems
with that support on RHEL 6.4 with SQLite 3.6.20.  It works fine on
Fedora and Ubuntu with SQLite 3.7.x.

To work around these problems, if we're using SQLite, test the SQLite
version inside the test that requires foreign key support,
and skip the test if it's < 3.7

Change-Id: I1c26f29371376b271a4e384ea7b5d2009651acc1

commit_message:
Avoid using whitespace in test_safe_parse_xml.

Updates our MiscellaneousXMLUtilTests.test_safe_parse_xml test
so that it avoids using and ignores whitespace. This works around some
minidom parsing differences that can happen with some versions of python
2.6.

Fixes LP Bug #1158826.

Change-Id: Iada0b095ab3b5ac6dc026b3ff6cdfb175f1e20a7

commit_message:
Update hacking.py for @testtools.skip() formatting.

This commit updates the hacking rules to add a strict format for bug
skips. Previously, there was no defined rules for skip formatting
which caused a number of test skips to be added without consistent
formatting. These skips then failed to get picked up by
tools/skip_tracker.py. This commit adds a new hacking test to ensure
that any skips added conform to a format that the skip_tracker will pick
up. HACKING.rst was also updated to explain the new rules being enforced.

Change-Id: I95f3ec7de2ee5e2039d53ad9565b5cec936a7672

subject: Revert "A test for concurrency when glance uses sleep."
messages:
[{'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-03-22 04:35:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Since its a bit nasty of me to remove this after it just landed, I wanted to provide my rational.

1) This test was causing some problems in the bug listed in the commit message. There may be other ways around that problem as Chuck proposed, but removing it is cleaner.
2) This test is slow, taking at least 2 seconds per run. Yes, 2 seconds is slow--maybe not slower than a bunch of other tests we have, but that just means we've got a lot of tests to fix.
3) This test is ultimately testing whether or not eventlet monkey patching works, not just whether it is called with the right argument. Generally speaking, we shouldn't spend time testing external libraries.
4) Tracking concurrency and performance is best left to benchmarking suites, not test suites.

Hopefully one or more of these items has some appeal to other folks."}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-03-22 04:36:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Okay, gerrit formatting made that hard to read. Let's try it again.

Earlier I said:

Since its a bit nasty of me to remove this after it just landed, I wanted to provide my rationale.

1) This test was causing some problems in the bug listed in the commit message. There may be other ways around that problem as Chuck proposed, but removing it is cleaner.

2) This test is slow, taking at least 2 seconds per run. Yes, 2 seconds is slow--maybe not slower than a bunch of other tests we have, but that just means we've got a lot of tests to fix.

3) This test is ultimately testing whether or not eventlet monkey patching works, not just whether it is called with the right argument. Generally speaking, we shouldn't spend time testing external libraries. 

4) Tracking concurrency and performance is best left to benchmarking suites, not test suites.

Hopefully one or more of these items has some appeal to other folks."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-22 05:08:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed.  For information on how to proceed, see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GerritJenkinsGithub#Test_Failures

- http://logs.openstack.org/25107/1/check/gate-glance-pep8/4244 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25107/1/check/gate-glance-docs/2279 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25107/1/check/gate-glance-python26/3699 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/25107/1/check/gate-glance-python26-rhel6/11 : FAILURE (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/25107/1/check/gate-glance-python27/3729 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25107/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/9999 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25107/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/9714 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25107/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/15471 : SUCCESS
"}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-03-22 08:37:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

There is nothing nasty about fixing problems.  Here is my take (in reverse order)

WRT #4, I agree.

WRT #3, I do not agree.  This tests whether or not we are monkey patching an imported module, not if the underlying library effectively does the monkey patching.  The latter is assumed.  This test was proposed after it was noticed in 
https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/988099 that the time module was not being monkey patched, not whether or not the underlying library was doing so in an effective or efficient manner. The test was made to ensure that future changes did not undo the fix to that bug.

WRT #2, In this case I agree.  But it could be a bad precedent.  The value of test should not be measured in the time it takes.  Possibly in a value/time ratio but I would rather see options to the test suite which skip long running tests (at a granularity that the user can set) instead of removing them due to their length.

WRT #1, If it causes problems it needs to go.  This is definitely low risk, so if it is causing more time than it has the potential to save (and it seems that it is) than lets get rid of it.  This probably goes without saying because I am sure that we all agree it is better to figure out why a test is causing problems than it is to delete tests that do so.  It appears that this was done here.'}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2013-03-22 15:57:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I have a work around for this:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24997/"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-03-22 17:26:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

John,

Do you suppose there is a way we could test this a little more directly, perhaps by cheating a little? Something like this pseudocode:


  def test_monkey_patch(self):
      import some.particular.module
      self.assertTrue(patcher.time_is_patched())'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-03-22 20:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Yes actually it seems that there is a surprising easy way to test this:

eventlet.patcher.is_monkey_patched(time)

How about it I alter the test to simply iterate through a few of those?'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-03-22 21:34:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

I think that Chuck's patch is good and works.  However it is probably best to test this functionality in the way that Mark suggested and avoid the 2 second hit.  I submitted a new test for review here:

https://review.openstack.org/25188"}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-03-25 18:19:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

John has a change proposed to fix this test here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25188/'}]

commit_message:
Revert "A test for concurrency when glance uses sleep."

This reverts commit 9a01d5389ac3235279f75256815e23e49ebc0c6a.

The functional test was causing problems in some testing rigs, pushing
the cost-benefit analysis into negative territory.

Fixes bug 1158247

Change-Id: Ie873584db812d4b3149ed3504f8bf29da56c8f38

commit_message:
Fixed broken vncproxy flush tokens patch

Bug 1125378 (continued)

This review (https://review.openstack.org/22872) attempted to
resolve a critical security issue but ended up completely breaking
the vncproxy. The wrong dict keys were being used for Essex and the
API calls were incomplete. This patch makes the proxy work again.

Change-Id: I093d522abd5be20d2792c83792437b1ef580d4c6

commit_message:
Fixes Nova API /os-hosts missing element "zone"

Now the HostIndexTemplate of Nova /os-hosts API is missing element "zone",
which will cause the XML output of list hosts missing the zone attribute.

Fixes bug: 1159055

Change-Id: I9940efcfd364c35b00cde4398d531d7ff56dc2b9

Sync lockutils from oslo-incubator stable/grizzly.

Changes include:

21925b6 Fix locking issues in Windows
547ab34 Fix Copyright Headers - Rename LLC to Foundation

Fix bug 1158179.

[{'created': '2013-03-25 14:31:36.000000000', 'message': "Initialize compute manager before loading driver.

The compute virt API uses the conductor API instance on the compute
manager.  Make sure the compute manager has been fully initialized
before loading the driver and passing it the virtapi instance.  This
prevents the possibility of the driver calling back into the compute
manager and using something not initialized yet, such as the conductor
API in the case of this bug.

This patch also moves initialization of a member variable up above
super(), where the rest of the initialization is.  There doesn't appear
to be a reason for needing to have it at the end.

Fix bug 1156490.

Change-Id: I19684f24d590201d135336107425c2be2f74c83e
(cherry picked from commit 9075069098e32b47bd5011e2653a23b61c18d4a3)
"}]
commit_message:
Initialize compute manager before loading driver.

The compute virt API uses the conductor API instance on the compute
manager.  Make sure the compute manager has been fully initialized
before loading the driver and passing it the virtapi instance.  This
prevents the possibility of the driver calling back into the compute
manager and using something not initialized yet, such as the conductor
API in the case of this bug.

This patch also moves initialization of a member variable up above
super(), where the rest of the initialization is.  There doesn't appear
to be a reason for needing to have it at the end.

Fix bug 1156490.

Change-Id: I19684f24d590201d135336107425c2be2f74c83e
(cherry picked from commit 9075069098e32b47bd5011e2653a23b61c18d4a3)

commit_message:
Make _downsize_quota_delta() use stashed instance types

This change changes the _downsize_quota_delta() method to take instance
as a param instead of migration_ref, and use it to extract the old and new
instance_types instead of looking them up in the database. This is needed
for this case since the method can be called from compute manager during
the periodic task to confirm pending migrations, and thus access to the
database may not be allowed.

Fixes bug #1158897

Change-Id: I647c51bc4d30e6dfd62abe7b65a9109d6aa2bb6f

Sorry - my first nova commit and I forget to run pep8! I'll get used to the style soon I'm sure.  Fixed.

In terms of caching, there isn't much benefit in caching the xenstore reads (which are relatively quick and only called from two places) - but we should think about caching the OpaqueRef (which is much slower since it's a XAPI call and called multiple times).

I'd rather this went into a separate change though."}, {'account_id': 642, 'date': '2013-03-19 15:07:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Using XenServer 5.6 this seems to fail for SmokeStack:

==> /var/log/nova/compute.log <==
2013-03-19 15:15:37.359 8746 CRITICAL nova [-] Unexpected error while running command.
Command: sudo nova-rootwrap /etc/nova/rootwrap.conf xenstore-read /local/domain/1/vm
Exit code: 1
Stdout: ''
Stderr: "/usr/bin/xenstore-read: couldn't read path /local/domain/1/vm\n"'}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2013-03-20 09:43:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

See the comment inline.

Please, also cover the new functionality with some tests."}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-03-20 12:00:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Dan,

I'm very confused - reading /sys/hypervisor/uuid should eventually read the information from xenstore in the way that I'm doing here (hence /sys/hypervisor/uuid should never work if the code I submitted did not work).  I don't yet have a F16 guest to test, but I've tested several other guest types and am not able to reproduce the error you've seen.

Is there somewhere that details the setup in the smokestack environment?

The questions I have regarding the failure are:
* Can you confirm if you're running 5.6, 5.6FP1 or 5.6SP2? The build number from /etc/xensource-inventory should be enough
* Is /sys/hypervisor/uuid readable after a reboot (i.e. verify that the bug occurs in the setup) - if it does then Mate's suggestion of using /sys/hypervisor/uuid and then xenstore if it causes an exception would not fix the bug for your setup
* Can we get a dump of xenstore-ls -pf from dom0?  The /local/domain/<dom>/vm key should always exist - and does exist back to XenServer 5.5.  Therefore the error saying that it can't be read doesn't make sense!

If there are details on how to set up the environment then I'll follow them and try and get the answers above."}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-03-20 12:08:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Sorry, I've just discovered that kernel commit 5c13f8067745efc15f6ad0158b58d57c44104c25 introduces a different mechanism for getting the uuid through /sys/hypervisor/uuid - so depending on the guest kernel there really are two alternatives available

I'll update my change to try both approaches."}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-03-20 14:51:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2013-03-20 14:52:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
xenapi: Retrieve VM uuid from xenstore.

Fall back to retrieving the uuid from xenstore if
/sys/hypervisor/uuid isn't accessible.

Change-Id: I409079068d3102ff86a71431b29c1ce2e6fe8857
Fixes: bug #1157211

http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 191, 'date': '2013-03-25 15:54:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

we've had huge problems with nova having to call out to other services on init in large deployments. When the calls failed or were slow, it prevented nova from booting properly. Which in a large deployment causes a lot of novas to fail at boot.

also, periodic task for keeping cache up to date would probably be a better way to do this, if it can be made to make sense in this context"}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2013-03-25 16:32:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

trey,

The call to network api  to update db cache info when init nova-compute only need to be run once after upgrading  from folsom to grizzly, periodic tasks can't solve this problem because db cache need to be updated at nova-compute process init."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-25 16:58:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-08 03:36:27.000000000', 'message': "Update networkinfo cache to include vif_type.

vif_type is add to networkinfo model at grizzly, and when upgrade
from folsom to grizzly, we need to update the existed instance's
networkinfo cache to add this param.

Change-Id: I1b839bf791b402b933354d9c17c5713fde21ab09
"}, {'created': '2013-03-08 04:46:38.000000000', 'message': "Update networkinfo cache to include vif_type.

vif_type is add to networkinfo model at grizzly, and when upgrade
from folsom to grizzly, we need to update the existed instance's
networkinfo cache to add this param.

Change-Id: I1b839bf791b402b933354d9c17c5713fde21ab09
"}, {'created': '2013-03-08 07:16:13.000000000', 'message': "Update networkinfo cache to include vif_type.

vif_type is add to networkinfo model at grizzly, and when upgrade
from folsom to grizzly, we need to update the existed instance's
networkinfo cache to add this param.

Change-Id: I1b839bf791b402b933354d9c17c5713fde21ab09
"}, {'created': '2013-03-08 18:31:19.000000000', 'message': "Update networkinfo cache to include vif_type.

vif_type is a new param in legacy_nw_info added at grizzly,  and when upgrade
from folsom to grizzly, the existed instances's network info cache in the db doesn't
contain this param, which is needed by vif driver to plug vif to instance.
nova-compute ensure vif is pluged to instance when starts. so we need to update
the existed instance's network info cache before pluging instance's vif.

fix bug #1152426

Change-Id: I1b839bf791b402b933354d9c17c5713fde21ab09
"}, {'created': '2013-03-12 04:05:53.000000000', 'message': "Update networkinfo cache to include vif_type.

vif_type is a new param in legacy_nw_info added in grizzly,  and when upgrading
from folsom to grizzly, the existing instance's network info cache in the db doesn't
contain this param, which is needed by vif driver to plug vif to instance. Nova
compute will try to plug the vif when it starts the instance, so we need to update
the existing instance's network info cache before pluging instance's vif.

fix bug #1152426

Change-Id: I1b839bf791b402b933354d9c17c5713fde21ab09
"}, {'created': '2013-03-20 11:30:14.000000000', 'message': "Update instance network info cache to include vif_type.

vif_type is a new param in legacy_nw_info added in grizzly, and when upgrading
from folsom to grizzly, the existing instance's network info cache in the db doesn't
contain this param, which is needed by vif driver to plug vif to instance. Nova
compute will try to plug the vif when it starts the instance, so we need to update
the existing instance's network info cache before pluging instance's VIF.

fix bug #1152426

commit_message:
Update instance network info cache to include vif_type.

vif_type is a new param in legacy_nw_info added in grizzly, and when upgrading
from folsom to grizzly, the existing instance's network info cache in the db doesn't
contain this param, which is needed by vif driver to plug vif to instance. Nova
compute will try to plug the vif when it starts the instance, so we need to update
the existing instance's network info cache before pluging instance's VIF.

fix bug #1152426

Change-Id: I1b839bf791b402b933354d9c17c5713fde21ab09

[{'created': '2013-03-19 20:53:57.000000000', 'message': 'Make dd block size user configurable

This patch introduces a new configuration option volume_dd_blocksize
to change the bs parameter passed to the dd command when creating or
deleting volumes. In certain scenarios changing the block size might
result in better performance.

The default value is still 1M, which was used before.

Fixes: bug #1157417

commit_message:
Make dd block size user configurable

This patch introduces a new configuration option volume_dd_blocksize
to change the bs parameter passed to the dd command when creating or
deleting volumes. In certain scenarios changing the block size might
result in better performance.

The default value is still 1M, which was used before.

Change-Id: I0398436ab3ecca51f6121e8f521af8b2dc60acd3
Fixes: bug #1157417

commit_message:
enable xml error message response

return xml error message when Accept:application/xml request received.
default to json response when none specified.

Change-Id: Idd454c5bc76adb583bc0a9afce9f31659e7fe2ac

commit_message:
Allow publishing arbitrary headers via the "storage.objects.*.bytes"
counter

The change allow publishing arbitrary headers via the
"storage.objects.*.bytes" counter of the swift middleware.

The list of the headers to publish can be configured in the swift
middleware filter like this:

[filter:ceilometer]
use = egg:ceilometer#swift
metadata_headers = X_VAR1, x-var2

Change-Id: I26a4a573707a778c5b86d298840e7ae25a95deea

commit_message:
Multi-node setup: Fix keystone host

Fixes bug 1154587.

Use KEYSTONE_AUTH_HOST instead of SERVICE_HOST when setting nova auth
parameters. Also use KEYSTONE_AUTH_PROTOCOL instead of SERVICE_PROTOCOL.

Change-Id: I54f7f31f6b795833b38968f6beea68e429f01d55

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-05 10:23:38.000000000', 'message': 'api: run list_resources test against SQL

This led me to discover and fix bug #1144837, which makes the SQL engine
returns correctly the list of resources when asked.

This also fixes a bug in the /resources listing in MongoDB driver: it used
to filter on the resource db, which only contains the most recent up to date
version of some fields, and returns wrong results.

Change-Id: I7441a8f2839c7db198c80de75f5c39f0dd219813
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
api: run list_resources test against SQL

This led me to discover and fix bug #1144837, which makes the SQL engine
returns correctly the list of resources when asked.

This also fixes a bug in the /resources listing in MongoDB driver: it used
to filter on the resource db, which only contains the most recent up to date
version of some fields, and returns wrong results.

This also fixes bug #1131349

Change-Id: I7441a8f2839c7db198c80de75f5c39f0dd219813
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

subject: Fixes report state failed with qpid rpc backend

commit_message:
Pass project id in quantum driver secgroup list

The quantum driver is always returning security groups from every tenant
a user has access to, even when the "project" filter is supplied.

Make sure we pass along the project value when we call
quantum.list_security_groups() so it's properly filtered.

Fixes bug 1155381.

Change-Id: I682c66a1f3f9db18b5f9924a37b45c759ff259f7

commit_message:
Include Co-authored-by entries in AUTHORS.

Co-authored-by lines are the way we've decided to indicated shared
authorship of a patch, so content from them should be included in
the generated AUTHORS file.

Fixes bug 1158319.

Change-Id: I9dacf78c01f3ad74e696f16a7aa39edb98e8d185

[{'created': '2013-02-26 20:17:32.000000000', 'message': 'use paste instead of stuff

the screen man page seems to say stuff is not suitable for long
strings (it is instead "performant"). Instead of using stuff we
can use the register / paste combo. This may have an effect on races
that we are seeing.

Paste also will let us control the paste rate, if we believe that
would help with the non screen start up behavior.

Change-Id: Ib5ddc829e91bb630b1d06d36f9817234194ef31a
'}]
commit_message:
use paste instead of stuff

the screen man page seems to say stuff is not suitable for long
strings (it is instead "performant"). Instead of using stuff we
can use the register / paste combo. This may have an effect on races
that we are seeing.

Paste also will let us control the paste rate, if we believe that
would help with the non screen start up behavior.

Change-Id: Ib5ddc829e91bb630b1d06d36f9817234194ef31a

commit_message:
xenapi: fix console for rescued instance

Check if the instance is in vm_state RESCUED and if so
change the name-label to reflect that. Name label is used
to get vm ref and currently the original instance is being
referenced even when in rescue mode. If rescue vm is not ready
yet, InstanceNotReady is raised.

Added tests cases for xenapi get_vnc_console for instance
and rescue mode.

Fixes bug #1157389

Change-Id: I5438103d517c40c1c87ddecd5f88b1487bfc0339

commit_message:
Create independent BlockStorage admin guide

This change just does the initial work of seperating the BlockStorage (volume)
documentation out of compute admin into it's own BlockStorage admin guide.

This is mostly a copy/paste of the info that was in ComputeAdmin and removal
of the N/A pieces that were in ComputeAdmin.xml, with the addition of seperating
each vendors drivers doc into it's own independent file.

There's quite a but of updating in the pipeline to make this document better, but
the first step was just the initial seperation here.

Patchset gets pom.xml to work -- to build and publish, need to add jobs to the
openstack-infra/config project. Minor edits in the intro and a pointer to the
storage decisions section of the Operations Guide.

Fixes bug: 1155670

Change-Id: I468b25a2c737c224cc19f82f861e7617af085c33

In ops manual: when running a daemon from the CLI, run as the
appropriate user (e.g., glance, nova, keystone) instead of as root.

This will catch incorrect permission errors that wouldn't appear when
running as root.

Change-Id: Iccc112cf69de5c9d2c96dce2dd27e804ae5f7b8e

commit_message:
Run daemons as appropriate user

In ops manual: when running a daemon from the CLI, run as the
appropriate user (e.g., glance, nova, keystone) instead of as root.

This will catch incorrect permission errors that wouldn't appear when
running as root.

Change-Id: Iccc112cf69de5c9d2c96dce2dd27e804ae5f7b8e

commit_message:
Allow for prettytable 0.7.x as well

Relax requirements to >= 0.6, < 0.8, as 0.7.x seems to
work as well. Added testcase to ensure this in glanceclient.

Change-Id: Ib7f6d99ede09846072a6df8328b7c317a1826946

'}, {'created': '2013-03-24 07:41:15.000000000', 'message': 'Locking edge case when lock_path does not exist

commit_message:
Locking edge case when lock_path does not exist

Fixes bug 1158179

In the case that the lock_path does not exist and there is a contested
resource then the process that was waiting on the lock will not
be locking due to the fact that the directory was deleted.

Change-Id: I75d720d4df499e85386d3e2cc86b927b017e12ac

subject: Don't log traceback on rpc timeout.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-03-22 18:09:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is done in oslo-incubator as of:

commit 229b815fb72dccf998b18a0ad019cc61ccb888d8
Author: Matthew Sherborne <msherborne@gmail.com>
Date:   Sun Mar 10 11:06:38 2013 +1000

    Improves Logging for for rpc method timeouts
    
    This patch moves the traceback for an rpc timeout from inside an
    iterator, which gave a useless traceback, into the main flow of the
    program.
    
    It also adds the rpc method being called and the topic used to the
    exception's message.
    
    When the caller logs the message higher up the stack, the log
    information and traceback will be more useful.
    
    Finally it removes the timeout logging in the amqp.py module, in the
    spirit of bug #1137994 and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/23295/
    
    Works towards: bug #1148516
    
    Change-Id: I29a3b1b97c6114c4479e2b71c1257c4d72131535"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-22 18:54:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

[{'created': '2013-03-22 18:07:35.000000000', 'message': "Don't log traceback on rpc timeout.

Don't log a traceback in the rpc layer after a timeout() occurs while
waiting on a response to a call().  Let the caller get the exception and
decide whether it should be logged or not.

Fix bug 1158920.

Change-Id: I0387ab48899627cbc3eb1d7187067472ddefc1bf
"}]
commit_message:
Don't log traceback on rpc timeout.

Don't log a traceback in the rpc layer after a timeout() occurs while
waiting on a response to a call().  Let the caller get the exception and
decide whether it should be logged or not.

Fix bug 1158920.

Change-Id: I0387ab48899627cbc3eb1d7187067472ddefc1bf

commit_message:
Sync misc changes from oslo-incubator

This syncs most recent changes from oslo-incubator except the rpc
package.

Changes are:

  6e8b9ba Include Co-authored-by entries in AUTHORS.
  88d316f Locking edge case when lock_path does not exist
  1220b21 clarify --log-file comments
  65e3d8c update OpenStack, LLC to OpenStack Foundation
  9fe688a Initialize root logger in _setup_logging_from_conf()
  3e71cc4 Unignore log_format option
  21925b6 Fix locking issues in Windows
  ab50ac0 Fix inconsistency with auth_tok/auth_token
  cb82d35 Stop using --stat for ChangeLog.
  2cb8e45 support ISO 8601 micro-second precision
  bf6c087 Fixes import order nits
  8842a00 openstack.common.setup: fails to get version from git
  8ce5947 Change the check for the existence of .git directory.
  7417a60 returncode for Popen is valid only after communicate call

Change-Id: Ie94a6dd16c6d97241bc5840b81a2d936d5f1d305

subject: netns: ip netns exec <name> kill doesn't make sense
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/25094/1/check/gate-quantum-pep8/5952 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25094/1/check/gate-quantum-docs/5213 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25094/1/check/gate-quantum-python26/5586 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25094/1/check/gate-quantum-python26-rhel6/22 : FAILURE (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/25094/1/check/gate-quantum-python27/5600 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25094/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/15456 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi enikanorov.

The only way I can see is
- wait process exit
- loop until success
  - try to delete netns
  - if fail, try to shrink dentry cache somehow
    One possible way is 'sysctl -w vm.drop_caches=3'

I'm afraid that sysctl causes severe performance degradation
in system-wide wise.
So my approach used for netns_cleanup_util is just loop with sleep. and give up/log it after several loop."}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Enikanorov.
To reproduce the issue, please try
ip netns add aaaa;PID=$(ip netns exec aaaa /bin/bash -c "coproc /bin/sleep 10 & jobs -p"); sleep 1;kill -KILL $PID;ip netns delete aaaa
You may also want to look at the following patch and the comment in the code.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21489/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/21489/12/quantum/agent/linux/ip_lib.py
From line 115

Unfortunately I concluded that there is no simple reliable way to delete a given netns.
So my approach is to retry 'ip netns delete' several times and give up/log it after retry.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not familiar with lbaas code, though.
If you mean quantum.plugins.services.agent_loadbalance.driver.haproxy.namespace_driver.HaproxyNSDriver.destroy.
I think it has same issue I'm seeing.

- kill_pids_in_file() doesn't wait for process exiting after sending KILL signal
- Even after exit, there is a issue of lazy unmount and dentry in the kernel.

BTW HaproxyNSDriver can utilise quantum.agent.linux.external_process_manager, so that we can centralize the logic to handle the issue."}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Supplement.
If some processes uses the net namespace, it can't be deleted with EBUSY.
To know the process, the following command would help.

lsof -f -- /var/run/netns/<netns>"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/25094/2/check/gate-quantum-pep8/5990 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/25094/2/check/gate-quantum-docs/5249 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/25094/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/15768 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

- http://logs.openstack.org/25094/2/gate/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/15771 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

Looks good though I haven't tested it yet.

I often stop metadata namespace proxy by kill command without "ip netns exec". In this case I have never failed to delete a network namespace. I believe this patch works fine.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I was looking at the same issue with lbaas namespace driver (bug/1155092), however, in the scenario described in that bug your patch and initial code produce the same result: namespace doesn't get deleted.

Is there anything that can be done there?"}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

you're right: despite driver doesn't wait for process exit, it's not the cause of EBUSY error, so lsof shows nothing.
Is there a way to deal with lazy unmount?"}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

from my experiments with same issue in lbaas, i could only delete a namespace after haproxy process was restarted in another namespace. I don't know how these events could be related, but that's what happening:
ns1 is deleted with EBUSY error which causes resync of state in lbaas agent so it restarts haproxy in all other namespaces where it was created. After that ns1 could be deleted.
Also, ns1 is always successfully deleted if it was the only namespace in which haproxy was started.
In lbaas terms: if there is a just one vip, it's deletion successfully finishes with ip netns delete.
If there is several vip (each with it's own ns and process in it), then deletion of some vips fails at namespace stage."}, {'account_id': 6072, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'message': "netns: ip netns exec <name> kill doesn't make sense

It seems confusing netns with pidns.
Although 'ip netns exec' doesn't make sense,
'ip netns exec <netns> kill <pid>' itself success as expected.
But as side effects, dentry of /proc/<pid>/ns/net becomes young,
which increases the possibility to fail to delete netns. That's not good.

Fixes: Bug #1158589
Change-Id: I9aa717ccb86d8bf00bb1e707d39bfb65d043532b
Signed-off-by: Isaku Yamahata <yamahata@valinux.co.jp>
"}, {'created': '2013-03-25 07:54:30.000000000', 'message': "netns: ip netns exec <name> kill doesn't make sense

It seems confusing netns with pidns.
Although 'ip netnex exec' doesn't make sense,
'ip netns exec <netns> kill <pid>' itself success as expected.
But as side effects, dentry of /proc/<pid>/ns/net becomes young,
which increases the possibility to fail to delete netns. That's not good.

Fixes: Bug #1158589
Change-Id: I9aa717ccb86d8bf00bb1e707d39bfb65d043532b
Signed-off-by: Isaku Yamahata <yamahata@valinux.co.jp>
"}]
commit_message:
netns: ip netns exec <name> kill doesn't make sense

It seems confusing netns with pidns.
Although 'ip netns exec' doesn't make sense,
'ip netns exec <netns> kill <pid>' itself success as expected.
But as side effects, dentry of /proc/<pid>/ns/net becomes young,
which increases the possibility to fail to delete netns. That's not good.

Fixes: Bug #1158589
Change-Id: I9aa717ccb86d8bf00bb1e707d39bfb65d043532b
Signed-off-by: Isaku Yamahata <yamahata@valinux.co.jp>

commit_message:
Reformat openstack-common.conf

Use the new 'module' option in openstack-common.conf which is a
multi-string option, allowing each module name to be placed on a
separate line.

This makes it much easier to review changes to the modules list.

Change-Id: Id7304b69cb8d5c1b7ca10899bb5d80fc374a8f02

commit_message:
Ensure memcache key must be string not unicode.

Original data instance["host"] get from db is unicode, when using
memcache, the key can only be string, so convert it to string.

Change-Id: I0e3f7c5fb5643e54d877117d7ab22ecbe4b598bb

commit_message:
Raise VipExists exception in case Vip is created or updated
for a pool that already has a Vip

fixes bug 1158049

Change-Id: I258a31f5d54c040ed478ab241b0e90f2bd0f69b3

commit_message:
Revert back to 'call' for agent reports

Fixes bug 1159581

The logic of the agents is based on RPC call()
since the agent needs to catch an exception over RPC.

Change-Id: I6d408216ebdfd130bab2555e61febd02b521985d

commit_message:
add test for creating a floating IP specifying an non-existent pool

fix bug 1144353

In the bug description, the tests for Creating a floating IP specifying
the default pool and listing existing floating IPs (with an user
authorized by policy.json) have been implemented in other tests.

Change-Id: Ic77fbc2d508eeff23ca0d757ebe8d806fe06be86

Added "live_migrate_server" method to servers_client.py
of XMl interface and XML interface Support functionality to
test_live_block_migration.py, so as to run the testscript

Implements: blueprint add-xml-support

commit_message:
Adds XML support to test_live_block_migration.py

Added "live_migrate_server" method to servers_client.py
of XMl interface and XML interface Support functionality to
test_live_block_migration.py, so as to run the testscript
using both JSON and XML interfaces.

Change-Id: I75098d59fa93a6f0ca83cdeb6cb2b0620beefe73
Implements: blueprint add-xml-support

Normalize skip bug format.

This commit changes all the bug formats in skip decorators to conform
to a single format:

Bug #\d+

Change-Id: Ifd1927837d433401c9b8cb80ca341f2e8d1f31d8

commit_message:
disable colorizer as it swallows fails

while the colorizer is pretty, it has the problem that fail output
actually gets completely swallowed when it is turned on.

Revert the use in run_tests.sh for now until it can be sorted out
so we don't prevent people from using run_tests.sh to do development.

Fixes bug #1159116

Change-Id: I3e6dfdc03c7b033ff132c00a51a368dae9789266

commit_message:
Catch KeyboardInterrupt

When a user Ctrl-C's the client, this will cause a short message to
be printed rather than an ugly backtrace.

This will not catch all instances of this (can still Ctrl-C before
reaching this code, etc.), but it should catch most of them, and those
for long-running sessions.

The specific message was chosen to match one recently added to the
glance client.

Change-Id: Ib748835ad1f94fb901b4941dc5e3797b719e197f

commit_message:
Add debug option processing to run_tests

This just adds -d|--debug option so you can debug
using tools like pdb again and to get extra output
from the tests.

Change-Id: Icebc17a1575e17cfd9597581546dca4732b9a8ef

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-24 22:19:48.000000000', 'message': "Fixed shared gigabytes quota resource.

The shared gigabytes resource between volumes and snapshots wasn't
working properly.  The issue was that on update/sync the action item
(volumes or snapshots) would update the resource usages based only on
it's own particular item.

This patch fixes that, and makes the total gigabytes truly shared
between volumesa and snapshots.

Fixes bug: 1159489

Change-Id: Ib1be9788f0beb4f94d010e4f816f9f3393371205
(cherry picked from commit d6935af9b3cdf73cc5dac2006d76a95e4c6cb35e)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed shared gigabytes quota resource.

The shared gigabytes resource between volumes and snapshots wasn't
working properly.  The issue was that on update/sync the action item
(volumes or snapshots) would update the resource usages based only on
it's own particular item.

This patch fixes that, and makes the total gigabytes truly shared
between volumesa and snapshots.

Fixes bug: 1159489

Change-Id: Ib1be9788f0beb4f94d010e4f816f9f3393371205
(cherry picked from commit d6935af9b3cdf73cc5dac2006d76a95e4c6cb35e)

commit_message:
Fixed shared gigabytes quota resource.

The shared gigabytes resource between volumes and snapshots wasn't
working properly.  The issue was that on update/sync the action item
(volumes or snapshots) would update the resource usages based only on
it's own particular item.

This patch fixes that, and makes the total gigabytes truly shared
between volumesa and snapshots.

Fixes bug: 1159489

Change-Id: Ib1be9788f0beb4f94d010e4f816f9f3393371205

[{'created': '2013-03-24 20:11:19.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes Cinder REST API /volumes issue

Issue #1
Once GET variable 'offset' is specified, the API /volume will get an empty
output.

Issue #2
Should validate the GET variable 'limit' before query database to get a
consistent message with Cinder REST API v1.
By current implement, error message is as below if the variable 'limit'
is invalid:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
{"computeFault": {"message": "The server has either erred or is incapable
of performing the requested operation.", "code": 500}}

After this change, the new message is as below:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
{"badRequest": {"message": "limit param must be an integer", "code": 400}}

Fixes Bug: 1154454

Change-Id: Ifb155477bae0ea3e39877737ee9019e7d8a104a7
(cherry picked from commit 7c760581d80b2ee5cd1e01a1d0a007770c9aa807)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes Cinder REST API /volumes issue

Issue #1
Once GET variable 'offset' is specified, the API /volume will get an empty
output.

Issue #2
Should validate the GET variable 'limit' before query database to get a
consistent message with Cinder REST API v1.
By current implement, error message is as below if the variable 'limit'
is invalid:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
{"computeFault": {"message": "The server has either erred or is incapable
of performing the requested operation.", "code": 500}}

After this change, the new message is as below:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
{"badRequest": {"message": "limit param must be an integer", "code": 400}}

Fixes Bug: 1154454

Change-Id: Ifb155477bae0ea3e39877737ee9019e7d8a104a7
(cherry picked from commit 7c760581d80b2ee5cd1e01a1d0a007770c9aa807)

commit_message:
Implement independent quota for snapshot-gigabytes.
The shared gigabytes implementation has some problems, but also
there's a desire from folks to have this independently controlled,
so we'll go ahead and use a specific quota class.

Fixes bug: 1159489

Change-Id: I74fa81467a0331e044f77cc8c0842a9b090c34c5

commit_message:
Last driver sync for Folsom and Grizzly

This is the last of the updates that I've been putting
off while trying to handle the core items in Cinder.

This change fixes the ctxt ordering error in volume_types
and also fixes and also changes the internal SolidFire
metadata storage to a single dict instead of a dict of dicts.

Change-Id: I002a591bc109ae1ab625c89f6ad841f60e464a40
(cherry picked from commit f53d48ebd9ff0e3b99470a9b95527c7054709c12)

[{'created': '2013-03-24 18:27:43.000000000', 'message': 'CoraidDriver: support users that are not admin

Add support to the CoraidDriver to specify a subgroup (with admin
privileges).
Coraid storage orchestration allows you to allocate portions of your
SAN to specific users/groups.
The driver should support this and not assume logging in
as "admin" (equiv to "root").

Will add another parameter to cinder.conf, "coraid_group",
and if present, the driver will authenticate using the specified group
as well as the already available coraid_user parameter.

Change-Id: I0d165955126adabce788ebdacd3a14a08edc8d8f
(cherry picked from commit 0a0251e695ed600ea586233b9654aedf4dab79e6)
'}]
commit_message:
CoraidDriver: support users that are not admin

Add support to the CoraidDriver to specify a subgroup (with admin
privileges).
Coraid storage orchestration allows you to allocate portions of your
SAN to specific users/groups.
The driver should support this and not assume logging in
as "admin" (equiv to "root").

Will add another parameter to cinder.conf, "coraid_group",
and if present, the driver will authenticate using the specified group
as well as the already available coraid_user parameter.

Fixes bug 1157354

Change-Id: I0d165955126adabce788ebdacd3a14a08edc8d8f
(cherry picked from commit 0a0251e695ed600ea586233b9654aedf4dab79e6)

commit_message:
CoraidDriver: support users that are not admin

Add support to the CoraidDriver to specify a subgroup (with admin
privileges).
Coraid storage orchestration allows you to allocate portions of your
SAN to specific users/groups.
The driver should support this and not assume logging in
as "admin" (equiv to "root").

Will add another parameter to cinder.conf, "coraid_group",
and if present, the driver will authenticate using the specified group
as well as the already available coraid_user parameter.

Fixes bug 1157354

Change-Id: I0d165955126adabce788ebdacd3a14a08edc8d8f

In cinder/volume/drivers/coraid.py, _login method, if login is
unsuccessful, we try to get the message from an undefined
object "response". Instead we should be getting it from "reply".

- errmsg = response.get('message', '')
+ errmsg = reply.get('message', '')

Fixes bug 1157499

Change-Id: Ifd047ced6b40f49881e81d4e73189d9bd216c903
(cherry picked from commit 4403230bbe8f39a19c38e58840bbb2283ccd808f)
'}]
commit_message:
CoraidDriver: typo in _login exception handler

In cinder/volume/drivers/coraid.py, _login method, if login is
unsuccessful, we try to get the message from an undefined
object "response". Instead we should be getting it from "reply".

- errmsg = response.get('message', '')
+ errmsg = reply.get('message', '')

Fixes bug 1157499

Change-Id: Ifd047ced6b40f49881e81d4e73189d9bd216c903
(cherry picked from commit 4403230bbe8f39a19c38e58840bbb2283ccd808f)

[{'created': '2013-03-23 21:35:08.000000000', 'message': "Fixed attach volume for EMC SMI-S iSCSI driver

This problem was encountered during Grizzly RC1 testing.  The driver
didn't find the correct target IQN.  As a result, Nova couldn't find
the matching path in /dev/disk/by-path and therefore detached the volume.

Change-Id: I8bcf6d9896b9d445f6376ecc3a5695be46507663
Fixes: bug #1157912
(cherry picked from commit 18bf0b386b2f26f524ebb6ab540941f64cad4642)
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed attach volume for EMC SMI-S iSCSI driver

This problem was encountered during Grizzly RC1 testing.  The driver
didn't find the correct target IQN.  As a result, Nova couldn't find
the matching path in /dev/disk/by-path and therefore detached the volume.

Change-Id: I8bcf6d9896b9d445f6376ecc3a5695be46507663
Fixes: bug #1157912
(cherry picked from commit 18bf0b386b2f26f524ebb6ab540941f64cad4642)

commit_message:
Fetch volume_types by uuid and not by name in v2

This was left over from the UUID switch. Looking up volume_types by name
is deprecated in v1 and removed in v2.

Fixes: bug #1087817
Change-Id: I02cc035565f9496cd5af228c55ced5cafef2ad81
(cherry picked from commit f5706319365dbd11cbc91bd69b09238afa51a626)

commit_message:
Snapshot reservation sync calls wrong resource.

The snapshot reservations code isn't calling the
correct resource on sync (it's calling volumes).  There's
also some problems with the logic being used on the delete/clean up
that are fixed here as well.

Fixes bug: 1157506
Fixes bug: 1157982

Change-Id: I91327b8043ab63aa35ea8a91b6de544bf5bf6c61
(cherry picked from commit b450eef832ff471b78776c9715b0878e95d69263)

commit_message:
Extend param2id() to work with uuids

Add uuid support to param2id() to allow commands including
cinder-manage volume delete to work with uuid style volumd ids

Fixes bug #1158409

Change-Id: I2d197320b61f44d1104ed0342a6b5b70f673468a
(cherry picked from commit e1561b8f8a05f3cd6b8635683b178f924384de65)

commit_message:
Add exception to import rule for gettextutils.

Importing _ from gettextutils is an acceptable excpetion to the
only import modules rule. Account for it.

Change-Id: I4ac2b8dd3f69292d87ed4a951ff93910f9468de4

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-14 08:28:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes Cinder REST API /volumes issue

Issue #1
Once GET variable 'offset' is specified, the API /volume will get an empty
output.

Issue #2
Should validate the GET variable 'limit' before query database to get a
consistent message with Cinder REST API v1.
By current implement, error message is as below if the variable 'limit'
is invalid:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
{"computeFault": {"message": "The server has either erred or is incapable
of performing the requested operation.", "code": 500}}

After this change, the new message is as below:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
{"badRequest": {"message": "limit param must be an integer", "code": 400}}

Fixes Bug: 1154454

Change-Id: Ifb155477bae0ea3e39877737ee9019e7d8a104a7

commit_message:
Fixes Cinder REST API /volumes issue

Issue #1
Once GET variable 'offset' is specified, the API /volume will get an empty
output.

Issue #2
Should validate the GET variable 'limit' before query database to get a
consistent message with Cinder REST API v1.
By current implement, error message is as below if the variable 'limit'
is invalid:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
{"computeFault": {"message": "The server has either erred or is incapable
of performing the requested operation.", "code": 500}}

After this change, the new message is as below:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
{"badRequest": {"message": "limit param must be an integer", "code": 400}}

Fixes Bug: 1154454

Change-Id: Ifb155477bae0ea3e39877737ee9019e7d8a104a7

commit_message:
Reset ec2 image cache between S3 tests.

We recently introduced EC2 image caching in 2865a76.

On some python 2.6 distros I'm now seeing nova.tests.image.test_s3
failures caused by test ordering issues. Tests appear to reuse
IDs and this can cause issue if we don't clear the cache in tearDown.

Fixes LP Bug #1158935.

Change-Id: Ifeedaf7a784b787de95d2f36394216cf7c94c5f4

commit_message:
CoraidDriver: do not call login from __init__

We should not call _login from the driver's __init__.
If the ESM is down, the constructor will fail.

- self._login()

Fixes bug 1157500

Change-Id: Ie57fbb6d3704d270a81cd9eb056d7988989da1f8
(cherry picked from commit 28102bc54ac2793ea17f47c81f6812bb84615834)

commit_message:
Remove the skips required by the fixed IP quota change.

Now that the fixed IP quota code has landed in nova, we can undo the
skips that were avoiding running quota tests in tempest.

Step two of the bug 1125468 two step. Let us never speak of these
things again.

Change-Id: I09d4e385c008fb4ece772d6ef11e7b19a24fc75a

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-28 11:15:33.000000000', 'message': 'Aggregate_metadata_get_by_host returns more than it should

The API call Aggregate_metadata_get_by_host returned way more than it should, including
metadata related to other hosts than the one being queried for. This is caused by the
secondaryjoin in the relations on _hosts and _metadata together with the use of
joinedload by the model definition in the Aggregate class. Causing the filter on
models.AggregateHost.host == host to be only partially effective in
Aggregate_metadata_get_by_host()

Change-Id: Ic517671e466e05d41f95bd19fc30f899197cc6d6
Fixes: bug #1133495
'}]
commit_message:
Aggregate_metadata_get_by_host returns more than it should

The API call Aggregate_metadata_get_by_host returned way more than it should, including
metadata related to other hosts than the one being queried for. This is caused by the
secondaryjoin in the relations on _hosts and _metadata together with the use of
joinedload by the model definition in the Aggregate class. Causing the filter on
models.AggregateHost.host == host to be only partially effective in
Aggregate_metadata_get_by_host()

Change-Id: Ic517671e466e05d41f95bd19fc30f899197cc6d6
Fixes: bug #1133495

commit_message:
Fix some issues that popped up when running against HPCloud.

* Check that text/html is not actually xml.
* Strip leading/trailing whitespaced from xml text.
* Check for 'retry-after' in HTTP 413 response header in
  addition to 'retryAfter' in HTTP 413 response body.

Change-Id: Iddd7e40388a2a39e986fb519d3cbbf1ff9874c6f

The password property of SecretsHelper erroneously calls utils.getenv
when attempting to evaluate the OS_VERIFY_PASSWORD environment
variable. Change to use utils.env instead.

Change-Id: I9c21561a4e246defba483bf848a618fbb6aefd2b
Fixes: bug 1132573
'}]
commit_message:
Correct erroneous call to utils.getenv

The password property of SecretsHelper erroneously calls utils.getenv
when attempting to evaluate the OS_VERIFY_PASSWORD environment
variable. Change to use utils.env instead.

Change-Id: I9c21561a4e246defba483bf848a618fbb6aefd2b
Fixes: bug 1132573

I'm fine with the code at this point, but would rather have some of the other core devs weigh in on whether and how Stackforge-project-specific mechanisms should be integrated into devstack-gate."}, {'account_id': 1925, 'date': '2013-02-21 16:21:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2013-02-21 22:57:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Do not merge

1) I'm not sure we can handle additional load on the devstack-gate servers right now.  I'd like to at least wait until we have the gearman work complete and the ability to spread out our jenkins load a bit more before running tests like this.

2) If we do decide to start running tests for non-core/incubated projects, the configuration for them should not be in devstack-gate.  Instead, I think you would need to add hook points to devstack-gate that do whatever setup you need there.  The primary purpose of the script is to gate the core and incubated OpenStack projects -- using it to test others is secondary; which is to say it's welcome, but only if it doesn't significantly increase the complexity and maintainability of the script."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2013-02-22 11:44:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Do not merge

(7 inline comments)

I've got another patch submitted, https://review.openstack.org/22673 that provides ability to do all of this from the calling jenkins job context without direct modification of devstack-gate.

Assuming that lands, I've added comments through this that indicate how this patch can be extracted and added to the jenkins job that would call these scripts."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2013-03-08 17:51:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I12802e3fedd8553e8401dcfaeaa62f8750609b69 did merge, by the way, so you'll want to rework this to use that interface now."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 2 weeks of no activity, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button  under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-23 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Added support for Reddwarf to devstack-vm-gate

Added support to conditionally set up Reddwarf and run the Reddwarf
Integration Tests as part of the devstack vm gate.

This will run when DEVSTACK_GATE_REDDWARF is set to 1. This is prerequisite
to being able to gate Reddwarf checkins based on the integration tests as
part of Openstack CI.

Implements blueprint: reddwarf-ci-integration
(under reddwarf-integration)

Change-Id: If2b2e565e7d81754559f5a7467a2a1ea7958bae5

[{'created': '2013-03-22 19:59:28.000000000', 'message': 'Make _downsize_quota_delta() use stashed instance types

This change changes the _downsize_quota_delta() method to take instance
as a param instead of migration_ref, and use it to extract the old and new
instance_types instead of looking them up in the database. This is needed
for this case since the method can be called from compute manager during
the periodic task to confirm pending migrations, and thus access to the
database may not be allowed.

Fixes bug #1158897

Change-Id: I647c51bc4d30e6dfd62abe7b65a9109d6aa2bb6f
'}]
commit_message:
Make _downsize_quota_delta() use stashed instance types

This change changes the _downsize_quota_delta() method to take instance
as a param instead of migration_ref, and use it to extract the old and new
instance_types instead of looking them up in the database. This is needed
for this case since the method can be called from compute manager during
the periodic task to confirm pending migrations, and thus access to the
database may not be allowed.

Fixes bug #1158897

Change-Id: I647c51bc4d30e6dfd62abe7b65a9109d6aa2bb6f

commit_message:
Include Co-authored-by entries in AUTHORS.

Co-authored-by lines are the way we've decided to indicated shared
authorship of a patch, so content from them should be included in
the generated AUTHORS file.

Fixes bug 1158319.

Change-Id: I9dacf78c01f3ad74e696f16a7aa39edb98e8d185

commit_message:
No need to edit glance paste files

As of Folsom, there is no need to edit the glance-api-paste.ini and
glance-registry-paste.ini files in a regular install of glance. Remove
references to this in the install doc.

For implementation details, see:
 * https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1043490
 * https://review.openstack.org/12149
 * https://github.com/openstack/glance/commit/b7197041f

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/24795

Change-Id: Ic3ef513f818727a7daebda2b7271e5dcd66ffe91

commit_message:
Last driver sync for Folsom and Grizzly

This is the last of the updates that I've been putting
off while trying to handle the core items in Cinder.

This change fixes the ctxt ordering error in volume_types
and also fixes and also changes the internal SolidFire
metadata storage to a single dict instead of a dict of dicts.

Change-Id: I002a591bc109ae1ab625c89f6ad841f60e464a40

Submitted this to the wrong bug. Will resubmit."}, {'account_id': 6857, 'date': '2013-03-22 22:32:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Submitted to wrong bug. Will resubmit.'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-03-23 00:06:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

some general notes.

We're trying to move away from kpartx:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1024586

Also virt-resize might be a more general solution:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/resize-no-raw

There is also the consideration that we might leave resizing of more complicated images to the images themselves, through cloud-init."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-22 22:27:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix resize2fs to accept filesystems on partitioned images

The resize2fs method will blindly try to fsck and resize an image. This is
problematic for images that may have multiple partitions. This patch tries
checking the given image to see if it has a partition table. If it does, and
if the filesystem type is an extended filesystem, it is resized.

Change-Id: I7fa2bb912b58f1399ee7c7937765944f842f9422
'}]
commit_message:
Fix resize2fs to accept filesystems on partitioned images

The resize2fs method will blindly try to fsck and resize an image. This is
problematic for images that may have multiple partitions. This patch tries
checking the given image to see if it has a partition table. If it does, and
if the filesystem type is an extended filesystem, it is resized.

Change-Id: I7fa2bb912b58f1399ee7c7937765944f842f9422

'}]
commit_message:
Rename trust extension (bug 1158980)

Change trust extension from RH-TRUST to OS-TRUST so that the namespace
being used is for OpenStack, as opposed to a contributing company.  This
is also more consistent with namespacing used in other OpenStack APIs.

Some additional discussion about this is in this thread:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-March/006876.html

Change-Id: I0fd869abe0f527c899808a4dde19dbd1fb6f32cd

subject: Locking edge case when lock_path does not exist
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-21 08:44:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/24975/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pep8/1274 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24975/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-docs/1078 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24975/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-pyflakes/941 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24975/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python26/1261 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24975/1/check/gate-oslo-incubator-python27/1263 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-03-21 09:47:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Drats good point. The lock is on the inode, not the directory entry, so the directory entry needs to be maintained to map to the correct inode.

The same argument applies to the temp dir case too right?
I.E. we can't cleanup as we do now in that case either.

To allow cleanup it might be possible for each process to:
touch lock_path.$pid and rm lock_path.$pid in __init__()
and __del__() of _InterprocessLock respectively.
Then cleanup would only proceed if the directory had
a single file present (lockfile).
Tricky to do without races"}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-03-21 14:45:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I am not sure about the temp rules. From reading the code it seems that the log_path will always be defined. I am not sure that that is relevant.'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-03-21 15:23:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I should mention that for lower level use cases like this,
one can use the existing code like:

  lock_dir = CONF.lock_path or "/blah"
  fileutils.ensure_tree(lock_dir)
  lock = lockutils.InterProcessLock(lock_dir+'qa-mutex')
  try:
      lock.trylock()
  except IOError as e:
      if e.errno in (errno.EACCES, errno.EAGAIN):
          LOG.warn("lock already held")'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2013-03-21 16:17:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Disregard previous comment, it was for another change'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-21 16:34:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Gary, Anyway we can test this in a test case?'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-03-21 16:41:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi,
I was able to reproduce it with the task - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/24412/

The reproduction is pretty simple:

@lockutils.synchronized('quantum-agent', 'qa-', external=True)
def agent():
    time.sleep(1000000)
    print("====> oy!")


If you run this in two different processes (it is important to note that the lock directory should not exist)

The do the stop start and it happens'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-03-21 18:04:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry the oy should be before the sleep'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2013-03-21 19:17:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-22 10:37:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-22 10:40:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Ok, as Pádraig says, this code should never be deleting the lock directory. It also doesn't make sense for it to create a temporary directory. It's much safer altogether if we just remove the director creation and removal code and make the caller ensure the directory exists.

However, such a cleanup is too risky for backporting to Folsom and Grizzly ... so I think it's best to go ahead with this isolated fix for now.

It means we're leaking a directory but - as Pádraig points out on IRC - we're no longer creating lots of files in this directory so it's not such a big deal.

I've taken the liberty of writing a failing test for this and rebasing onto that."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-22 10:46:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Locking edge case when lock_path does not exist

Fixes bug 1158179

In the case that the lock_path does not exist and there is a contested
resource then the process that was waiting on the lock will not
be locking due to the fact that the directory was deleted.

Change-Id: I75d720d4df499e85386d3e2cc86b927b017e12ac

@amotoki

The reported bug is actually another bug in eventlet/sqlalchemy that is masking the real bug.  I've linked in the bug report background on eventlet/sqlalchemy problem.  The ultimate bug is caused by a stale data updates when the Quantum server is (re)started after the agents have been running.  The fix discards the entries knowing that the agents will send updates within the reporting_interval to make the state current."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2013-03-22 21:58:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
Add a comment to placeholder migrations.

We've had a review that tried to reuse migration 162 rather than
skipping to 172.  Maybe a comment will prevent that in the future.

Change-Id: Ib8b73260df593d13a81ce65c85a302a54668b95e

/FYI/ Diff from patch set 12 is as follows:

- Use LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver explicitly in OVS based plugin with iptables secgroup
- Make linuxbridge plugin with Q_USE_SECGROUP=False work (The default firewall_driver for linuxbridge agent is IptablesFirewallDriver, so firewall_driver needs to be set to NoopDriver when Quantum security group is not used)
- Move common logic in OVS based plugin with iptables secgroup to ovs_base'}, {'account_id': 4395, 'date': '2013-03-22 19:32:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

- Specifying device_owner type on debug port in lib/quantum and
  quantum-adv-test.sh. This change makes apply quantum security
  group fro debug port

Change-Id: Ifd155798912247d85a9765ef73a2186b929237b4
'}]
commit_message:
Support Quantum security group

Adds Q_USE_SECGROUP flag for quantum security group

- Added has_quantum_plugin_security_group method for each plugin.
- Set NOVA_VIF_DRIVER to the hybrid VIF driver for plugins with
  iptables based security group support.
- Specifying device_owner type on debug port in lib/quantum and
  quantum-adv-test.sh. This change makes apply quantum security
  group fro debug port

Change-Id: Ifd155798912247d85a9765ef73a2186b929237b4

messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-20 00:33:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/24858/1/check/gate-swift-pep8/1921 : SUCCESS

'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-03-20 00:47:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

(2 inline comments)

I don't understand the recommendation to *not* use the suffix. Why not recommend the use of both?"}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-03-20 06:37:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@gholt 
The recommendation is not to *not* use the suffix. 
Instead, the recommendation to use suffix was removed which is a great difference :)

As far as my investigation goes, suffix simply does not add to security. It also does not harm security.  

Hence it makes little sense to recommend using it to a new installation as it (1) somewhat harm performance (2) only adds a false sense of security  - like putting another lock on your door when the window is open.

DH'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-03-20 07:25:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Well, either works for the original intended purpose, which was to keep someone from easily creating object names that all fall on the same ring partition, filling up specific drives, so I guess I don't care too much. ;)

Just seems weird that if everybody gets all panicky about these attack vectors that the suffix wouldn't just be used as well. Otherwise we'll probably get a patch within the next year for that. If someone's worried by that level of performance, they don't have to set both.

"like putting another lock on your door when the window is open"? What window is open? We should probably lock that. Or am I following the analogy too far? To me using both suffixes is like putting two different kinds of locks on your door in case someone figures out how to pick one kind.

[also, 2 inline comments]'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-03-20 12:42:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-20 13:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/24858/2/check/gate-swift-pep8/1924 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24858/2/check/gate-swift-docs/1756 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24858/2/check/gate-swift-python26/2004 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24858/2/check/gate-swift-python27/2006 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24858/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/9687 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24858/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/15097 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/24858/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/9402 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-03-20 21:59:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-03-21 23:48:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Alright, maybe I'm bikeshedding here, but why not recommend the use of both?

There are bad things that a prefix prevents that a suffix does not; what if there are bad things that a suffix prevents but a prefix does not? I can't think of any right now, but last week, I didn't know of any bad thing that a suffix didn't fix.

(To be clear, this comment is all about the docs; obviously the code still supports both.)

Also, will you please put the string "DocImpact" on its own line in the commit comment so the docs team gets notified of this change?'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-03-22 17:35:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Sam
I see no issue with having both prefix and suffix in the example configuration. I will send a new patch.

We have submitted earlier today another security measure to overcome hash collisions (See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/25110/). We are also working on additional measures of hardening this part of the system. Later as all measures are included, we will probably need to agree on a documentation change suggesting the alternatives that can be used and maybe some tradeoffs.'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-03-22 18:05:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-22 18:41:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Add support for Hash Prefix

A new configuration parameter is added to /etc/swift/swift.conf
[swift-hash]
swift_hash_path_prefix = 'random unique string'

New installations are advised to set this parameter to a random secret,
which would not be disclosed ouside the organization.
The same secret needs to be used by all swift servers of the same cluster.

Existing installations should set this parameter to an empty string
(the default)

DocImpact

Fixes: Bug #1157454

Change-Id: I63b10d0b7d6dd3f74e0f10bb41b5f240fa03578a
